Reviews.Title: “Good overall, but has a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: sandhun
Reviews.Content: Overall I am fairly pleased with Visconti Palace but there is room for improvement. Let me start with the negatives. There are no tea/coffee making facilities within the rooms. Cappucinos are available in the lobby area but they cost 5 euros each - definitley overpriced. You only get one hour free WiFi per day. It costs 9 euros if you want access for longer. Given that it only costs hotels about 65 pence per day to provide this service, I think it's a little unfair. The room price was £140 per night. I thought this was a little steep for what it was but I understand that Rome is an expensive city. At one point I asked a member of staff for the address of a bar. Whilst he looked it up, I happened to mention the district that it was located in (just to provide more information) but he cut me off rather abruptly, clearly not wishing to be distracted. I felt it was a bit rude of him. Now the positives - the rooms are a pretty good size, the lifts are quick. breakfast runs up until 11am. The location is pretty good - it's not especially close to any of the major sites but is within 15 minutes walk of many of the sites - e.g. Vatican to the West, Piazza Navona to the South and Spanish Steps to the East. The chap at breakfast advised us of some gluten free restaurants and he also provided some gluten free products at breakfast - he was very helpful. We did have a few other (fairly minor) issues but the hotel dealt with them in an efficient manner. Overall, this is a pretty good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thé best hotel in Rome in terms of location and quality for money”
Reviews.Author: Cmuteppwr
Reviews.Content: Thé best hotel in Rome in terms of location and quality for money

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with bigger rooms”
Reviews.Author: FoodNomad53
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place to stay just across the river from Piazza del Popolo and the old historic center. I prefer an even more central location to Visconti (e.g. vicinity of the Spanish Steps & Trevi), however, with the Visconti Palace you do get rooms that are roomier than almost all hotels in the very center, and you're really only about 10 minutes walk away anyway. The breakfast is always good at Visconti, but the coffee isn't as good as you'll find at the many bars around town. The beds & linens are always very comfortable (I always sleep well at this hotel). Our bathroom sink was not draining properly but the problem was fixed immediately after we called about it. WiFi only worked decent in the lobby and the login procedure is unnecessarily tedious (however, once you manage through the login maze, the signal strength and speed are fine, but only from the lobby). I have stayed at this hotel 3 times in the last 25 years and do not hesitate to return, and do when my #1 location hotels are booked or over-priced. This is a great hotel for families with kids because the rooms tend to be bigger & you get a great morning breakfast before heading out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kingpinky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 days on our trip to Rome. I was very impressed when we finally arrived at the hotel. Very nice and clean as well as sophisticated. We loved our room and had a nice view of the street. When I booked this hotel, I had no clue how close it was to St. Peters. The local shops and restaurants were neat and most vendors could speak enough English to get by. The only annoying part of out trip was the freakin ambulance sirens....it seemed as if the were going 24-7. We only ate breakfast at the hotel because there were inexpensive eateries in the neighborhood. Try Miss Pizza around the corner and watch the news in Italian :) If you are in decent shape, don't by a subway pass. The city is relatively small and you see sooo much more of it walking. It only took us 25 min to walk from the hotel to the coliseum (other side of town)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Ritje
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on an attractive rate via Thomas Cook. Coming from Fiumicino, take the SIT shuttle bus on platform 1, for 8 Euro it takes you to Piazza Cavour, the hotel is only on 5' walk of the stop. We asked for a quiet room, but the first day we were dissapointed, there was a lot of noise on the floor above us. The management moved us to a nice corner suite, and provided us with a bottle of Prosecco to apologize. From that day on, we enjoyed this fantastic holiday. Excellent, personal service in the restaurant and bar, very helpful receptionists, discrete and efficient chamber maids. The breakfast buffet is OK, (ask the waiter for a cappucino). Beautiful garden terrace and patio. Nice little restaurants in the neighbourhood. Visconti Palace is only on a 15' walk of Vatican City, Piazza del Popolo, the Spanish Steps and Piazza Navona. Is it because we speak a little bit Italian, that we had such a nice stay? We hope sincerely that it is Arrivederci Roma!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay if you want a quiet neighborhood and live close enough to Roman sites.”
Reviews.Author: GranDia
Reviews.Content: It's a short walk to Piazza Popolo and Piazza Spagne, just right behind the Palace of Justice. The Vatican is just over a kilomters's walk. In the neighborhood are nice restaurants and bistros and for those of you who perennially forget to bring chargers, there are a couple of computer and telecom shops. The hotel itself has a minimalist lobby but quite a large breakfast room in the basement. The rooms aren't large but comfortable. Just watch out for rooms with LAN cables that aren't close to the working tables. You can, of course, use the wi-fi which is reasonable at €9.00 per day. The patio, while small, has nice touches of green and on a sunny spring day will be a perfect place to wind down. One can sense that the staff are trying their utmost best to be polite and helpful. They are not yet there, but one can appreciate their efforts. I will certainly come back to this hotel and might make it as my home base should I come back to Rome. I recommend this hotel to those who value a quiet neighborhood and yet would want to be close enough to good restaurants and the Roman sites like Popolo Spagna and Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Rome is amazing, Hotel is adequate”
Reviews.Author: libbeadage
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really well positioned - 30 minute walk down to the collaseum and 20 minute walk to the Vatican. Really easy to get to both from the hotel and the hotel provide a good map. I went on my own not knowing any Italian and felt safe, good around well and thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel I would describe as a holiday inn express lookalike - perfectly fine and prices are probably as you expect for room (expensive) but was ok, nothing more, nothing less. Everyone behind the desk spoke English and were helpful if not overly enthusiastic. Note the gym is very small but also perfectly fine. All in all - I found the hotel perfectly central for what I was looking for in my short trip but wasn't wowed by the hotel but again had no complaints. It was fine, perfectly adequate for my travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for hotel near Vatican and Piazza del Popolo”
Reviews.Author: Mortbri
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights at the Visconti Palace Hotel in Rome in July 2011. It was a great choice for us being that it was close to the Vatican and walking distance from the Metro train station near Piazza del Popolo. The open breakfast in the mornings was the best that we had in Europe during our entire trip. Rooms were clean, quiet and comfortable. Great staff… I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “excellent start of exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: JessLightning
Reviews.Content: excellent place to stay. don't expect too much, but it does the job if you want a decent hotel. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: lesl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of group attending a rugby international. From the outside, the hotel is quite understated. However the public areas are bright and welcoming and the bedrooms, whilst not grand, are certainly more than adequate. The staff were very helpful throughout our stay. The buffet breakfast was excellent. There are several good small restaurants nearby and the hotel is a good starting point for walks to many of Rome's historic attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very Roman for a modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: williestewart
Reviews.Content: The Visconti Palace is located near the Parthenon and other of the major sights of Rome. It is a modern 4star and I had no criticism of the facilities or service. The rooms are value for money in size, thy are well appointed and everything worked including excellent Wifi. The hotel tries hard to create a Roman feeling with portraits and a widescreen of typical Roman scenes. The reception staff are polite, friendly and efficient. My room was cleaned both mornings of my stay during my breakfast. Excellent value for money in a city which is not inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “When In Rome!”
Reviews.Author: kris0740
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at this hotel. The people were very friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast was a good spread from cereal, eggs, bacon, fruit and a few more things. Visconti Palace is within walking distance to many of the local sites. I would definitely recommend this hotel and go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mary K
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nites and enjoyed everything---------------especially when we got off of the elevator,in front of us was a flat screen T.V. playing Andrea Bocelli in concert. Andrea, a nice room in a beautiful hotel, best area, food was very good, all this and the wonderful city of Rome. Simply a dream, close to everything! The only reason I didn't give them a 5 rating was the attitude of the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok with few bumps”
Reviews.Author: sanya86
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights based on reviews and recommendations from prior guests. Upon arrival check in was easy and our luggage was taken upstairs by bell boy I think mainly cause elevator is too small to fit 2 of us and the luggage. Lobby was very nice just like on hotel pictures, clean nicely kept, modern. Room was not as great but good. Green dated carpet had white stains on it which was not very pleasing. Breakfast was excellent can find food for absolutely any taste. On our second or third night we got to the hotel around 11pm and noticed there was no hot water, I thought we had to wait for it to warm up but that never happened so I took quick freezing shower and called it a day. Next morning there were still no hot water, so I went down to find out and they told me that they been working on it since yesterday and they are sorry. So we went on with our day upon return in the eve water was back on. Internet is also a big catch there. They give you an hour free but when you logging In you have to be careful to select free hour because if like us you use either iPhone or iPad you don't see whole page on the screen and don't see the area where you need to choose free hour as oppose to 9 euro per day which is their defult. So when we called to say that we made an error they said there is nothing they can do and even if we used it for 15 min we had to pay. I would expect hotel could compensate those 9 euros for luck of hot water but they did not feel the need for better service. Another big problem is that your neighbors you can hear like if they were in your room. From whispering to screaming and all other sounds you would not particularly want to hear

Reviews.Title: “A well located hotel, pleasant stay but could do better”
Reviews.Author: Nick W
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this property on business. It is very well located and the entrance and lobby are modern and bright. Staff are friendly and helpful too. Overall so far so good But there are some negatives: I found internet connection to be patchy (and not free) The bedrooms and fittings are all a little tired Breakfast was acceptable but could be better Water from the minibar was 5Euros which is too much!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: danielprague
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a room for 3 people which narrowed down our search, but this hotel met the criteria and was and excellent choice. location is great, we walked everywhere, place is modern, clean and we loved the breakfast buffet, even though its a sin to stuff yourself like that in the morning in italy..

Reviews.Title: “The Visconti palace reviewed”
Reviews.Author: ahakemul
Reviews.Content: Nice and very correct reception staff when we arrived, clean and big rooms, excellent breakfast with a lot of choice. The "tourist" quality cappucino was not as good as you might expect in Italy. The location is really good if you want to see the standard tourist sites, close to Vatican, borgo SantAngelo, piazza del popolo and so on..Easy walking distance and the cosey restaurants in TraStevere are a taxi ride away, cost you approx 7 euro to get there. Certainly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Quiet neighborhood, helpful staff, good location, allergic to room”
Reviews.Author: Chiquita15
Reviews.Content: We arrived the week of epic cold in Italy (and record snowfall) so this may impact the review. We didn't have hot water for 2 days until we figured out that we had to let the water run for 10 minutes until order to get the hot water flowing. They said when the hotel isn't full, it takes a while. I was also highly allergic to something in the room. I broke into a sneezing and congestion fit within a minute of being in the room, so I tried to spend as much time as possible in the lobby lounge. I asked for a hypoallerginic room but it didn't help. The beds were a bit hard for our comfort. However, the breakfast was good, the staff very helpful, and we loved the location. It was in a quiet residential neighborhood with lots of eateries nearby, a few blocks from the metro, and an easy walk to the Vatican and into the Centro Storico.

Reviews.Title: “Great position but its not a palace.”
Reviews.Author: princessivai
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean but reminded me of a 3 star- plain and no view- however they were clean! It was quite expensive. Breakfast was amazing. Best thing about this hotel was the location. Close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel + great breakfast near Piazza del Popolo & Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Martha M
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 nights and enjoyed it immensely. The location was an easy walk across the Tiber from all the sights you "need" to see: Spanish steps, Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, etc. but also close enough to walk to Vatican City. The rooms were nicely appointed: robes, slippers, bottled water daily, nice hair dryer, safe, TV and nice, big windows. Opening the hotel room door with ease takes a little practice, but once you learn, you'll wonder why you ever had trouble. Just pay attention when you leave to make sure the door is shut behind you. The lobby bar is charming. Recommendations: the Roma Salad, delicious. Warning: cappuccino there is 5 Euro. Go around the corner and for the price of 2 Visconti Palace cappuccinos, you can get 2 cappuccino, 2 pastries, and 4 slices of pizza. There is also a lovely terrace on the 7th floor, as well as a patio/courtyard right off the lobby, that you'll enjoy if the weather is right. The Wi-Fi is spotty up in the rooms, though strong in the lobby, so bring your adaptors or whatever so that you can plug-in to the Internet high-speed, if necessary. The breakfast buffet is standard Italian, but copious with a lot of variety. They guard the door, so if you want to take a piece of fruit with you for the day, slip it into your bag. Removing food is not permitted. Also not permitted, taking cups or glasses to your room. Any hotel food or drink you want in your guest room needs to be ordered from room service. Around the corner is a GREAT takeaway and sit-in pizza slice place, and a great gelataria / cappuccino bar. Just take a right at the newsstand on the corner. Pizza place right there on the right. Coffee bar on the corner at your first left.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: PatB855
Reviews.Content: My 12 year old son and I spent 4 days in Rome at the Visconti Palace. It was in an easy walking distance to all the sites in Rome. The staff was especially great, the breakfast was wonderful and the room was very nice. I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Lori E
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Visconti Palace and found the service and rooms to be top-notch. The front desk staff was helpful, friendly and accommodating, even when we needed to move to another room to accommodate the addition of my college-aged daughter when she needed to get away from her too-rustic Roman apartment for a few days. The bartenders were fun-loving and generous and we made it a habit to stop by each night before going to dinner. The breakfast buffet was huge and beautiful; no excuse to go hungry! The hotel is quite contemporary and immaculately clean. Easy walking distance to the metro and many attractions and great shopping. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: All of the staff were very friendly. The location of the hotel is quite good, about 10min walk to Vatican and 15min to some of the main spots of the Ancient Rome. There are good, reasonably priced restaurants nearby. The rooms were very spaceous and clean. Breakfast is surprisingly good and includes a wide selection. Free wifi for 30 min at lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: Dineman69
Reviews.Content: I stayed here fro 3 nights with my 12 year old son. Rooms were small but comfortable. Unfortunately it did smell of cigarette smoke. Don't panic if you don't have any hot water when you turn the shower on. It takes up to 5 mins to come through. The breakfast is great with everything you could want. I found the staff to be extremely helpful. They referred me to a travel agent just up the road called playtime who were fantastic and helped me organise train tickets and accommodation. There are many good little restaurants nearby. It's within walking distance to many of the major sites including the Trevino Fountain and Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Rome sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: BellaghyFiona
Reviews.Content: The Visconti Palace was a lovely place to stay during our short break in Rome. We ate breakfast in the hotel each morning and were out the rest of the day sightseeing until approximately 8pm. We did not have dinner in the hotel. The rooms are lovely and clean and the bathroom is of a good standard. The area is quiet yet very handy for tourist spots. The Vatican is twenty minutes on foot, as is the piazza popollo across the river. There was a good selection of cereals & pastries for breakfast, cheeses, fruit, yoghurt, scrambled egg, sausage & bacon. Only negative experience was the bar food. We ordered a sandwich and some vegetable soup. Both were extremely over priced but the soup was canned Heinz vegetable heated up in a microwave. I have eaten it enough over the years to recognise it when I see it!!! This cost nine euro! It is bad enough to be charged too much for the snacks!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Artem S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Executive Suite 704 on the seventh floor for a New Year Holiday 2012 from Dec 30th till Jan 3rd. Everything was very smooth and I can recall nothing to complain about: quality of rooms, breakfast & location were as expected and up to a standard. Just couple of things for the hotel to think about: - corkscrews are tough to use, one needs to invest a lot of effort to open bottles of wine from the minibar; - when I looked at the invoice at home I noticed that wi-fi usage was charged for, however my understanding (probably wrong) based on the hotel site information was that non-refundable rate for suites assumes free wifi. In general from my point of view the hotel lacks information on Internet usage in the rooms (even if the room rate assumes free Internet the system prompts you to accept charges and this is very MISGUIDING). But overall I would definitely recommend this hotel and rate it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in a Quiet Residential Area”
Reviews.Author: ATLBob
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that is clean, quiet and exceptionally convenient/close to many popular sites, this is the place to stay in Rome. If you prefer to be in a residential neighborhood situated among the homes and local businesses of native Romans, and away from the crush of the typical tourist zone, this is the place to stay. If you enjoy being able to walk to several unpretentious (but delicious) local restaurants that are predominantly frequented by its Italian-speaking neighbors, this is the place to stay. We enjoyed 5 nights at the Visconti Palace earlier this month and would stay here again in a heartbeat. When we arrived at approx. 10:00 a.m. after an overnight flight from Atlanta and were greeted by hotel staff (with a smile and in English!) and were told that our rooms were ready. The two hotel elevators were small (typical in Italy) but they worked well and came quickly. We judged the beds to be firm, but quite comfortable, and the size of the bathroom was similar to a typical American hotel--large by Italian hotel standards. Rooms had a small/mid sized flat screen TV with access to the typical Italian channels and many in various European/Middle Eastern/Chinese languages, including a few in English (British TV). We found the daily breakfast buffet to be very good and a great way to fortify ourselves before we headed out to see the sights. You'll find scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, a variety of cold meats/cheeses, yogurt, fruit, lots of breads/pastries, juices, coffee, tea, cappuccino and espresso--so there's lots to choose from. We ended our days with a bottle of wine/prosecco in the lobby lounge area, where the service was professional/polite, and included a variety of olives, chips, nuts (complimentary) that were served with the reasonably priced wines. We didn't get to experience the rooftop lounge area, since it was a bit cool and it drizzled off and on during our stay. The Visconti is a block West of the Tiber River, between the Ponte Cavour and Ponte Regina Margherita. It's a very short walk to the Castel Sant'Angelo, Piazza Del Popolo, Via Del Corso (shopping), Ara Pacis, Piazza Novona, Pantheon, Campo Di Fiori, Piazza Colonna, Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. It's only a 20-30 minute walk to St. Peters Square/The Vatican, Trastevere, the Vittoriano, dozens of beautiful Churches, and the Borghese. There's also a great nearby Espresso Bar (Mizzica), about a half-block away, that features delicious pastries to enjoy with your morning cappuccino. We enjoyed the pasta, veal and reasonably priced wine at Palazzaccio (one block away) twice: we were the only people there who weren't locals, but the owner speaks English and the waiter speaks enough English (along with my 'enough' Italian), so we did wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER BEEN TO!”
Reviews.Author: jumbalahiri
Reviews.Content: All the members of the staff were snob. The rooms were terrible. The service was terrible. They never answered the phone. It could be pronounced as the worst 4-star hotel in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and stay”
Reviews.Author: gramps3421
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in Rome and we changed to the Vistconti on this trip. One of the best decisions that we made on this visit. This lovely hotel is located within walking distance of the Vatican, Trevi fountain, Spanish steps, Piazza Navona - and other places of interest. The moring breakfast buffet was well prepared and the atmosphere was simply charming. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean. We booked on line and saved quite a bit of money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: adrian_bruder
Reviews.Content: We had a short family holiday in Rome and this hotel was perfect for exploring the city on foot which is what we did everyday.Rooms were fine, service, well, like in Italy, one must adjust and enjoy rather than criticise. Breakfast was superb, rooms clean. We would return with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Throughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ZaccyCia
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the hotel and I must say that it is one of the best that I have stayed in, can't understand some of the negative comments given to the hotel. Rooms were spotless and regularly cleaned. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. Bar staff, I think his name was Antonionne, was extremely pleasant had great conversations about our love for football, hope his brother get sorted out, he'll know what I am talking about. Back to the hotel, very modern, clean decor and I must say that the breakfast was outstanding plenty of choice, hot or cold. The location of the hotel, if you are looking for a base to visit all the main attractions, is ideal, most within walking distance but, beware, wear flat shoes, my wife will vouch for that. Finally, I will be recommending this hotel to others who are thinking of coming to the beautiful city of Rome, hopefully returning ourselves one day. Thanks for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “real pleasure, perfect quality for average price.”
Reviews.Author: Christifemus
Reviews.Content: Great location, near Vatican (1,5km - lovely walk though St. Angel Castle), very close to Subway Station (5m walk). I spent there 5 days this week and it was worth every penny. Special thanks goes for regular cleaning staff of the hotel, Ladies are doing great job. The are cleaning your room with enormous precision (even the cables for notebook, ipod and charger were lied down with special accuracy!). Room was enough big and bed (king size), was huge (actually it were two beds, but connected together so good, that i have notices that fact after three days:)). Most of the reception staff was friendly, except one old fellow (old school type) who was helpful but rather "difficult" in chating. Breakfast were at da good level, ans restaurant hall is very nice. Bar and design of the hotel are great, and a terrace on a roof is "a must see" and worth of spending there some time with good, full glass in your hands:)Overall? If i will go back to rome, im going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location, Fine Room”
Reviews.Author: carolblue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Visconti Palace for four nights, partially due to recommendations fromTripAdvisor reviewers. A previous reservation we had made was prepaid and we'd had to cancel due to a medical reason. Visconti Palace would not offer a refund. So in order to use up the credit we booked a Junior Suite instead of a regular room ... and we were not disappointed. The Junior Suite had an entry foyer, a living room with TV, sofa, desk and internet, a window-wall bedroom (windows did open) with a king size bed, TV, & plenty of drawer and hanging storage, and an amazing bathroom with shower/tub combo, toilet, bidet, sink and oodles of extra amenities including upgraded lotions & potions and his & her slippers. The included breakfast buffet was simply wonderful. If they didn't have something you wanted, shame on you. Meats, cheeses, pastries, breads, cereals, eggs, fruits, all sorts of juices, waters, coffee, tea etc etc. We had a couple of early tours and we joked that the Breakfast Buffet manager opened the doors exactly on time ... not one moment early. It was a filling and nutritious way to start our day. The hotel's location was great. Walking distance to many attractions & restaurants and the HoHo bus route (we love HoHo buses to get a feel for a city). Interestingly, several taxi drivers did not know of the hotel, so we had to offer the address. In short, the Visconti Palace is NOT inexpensive, but it's Rome after all, and I believe youj get what you pay for. A couple of the front desk people were superb, and a couple were borderline-surly (but there was a bowl of free apples). Overall, we'd return to Visconti Palace on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “thanks trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: miloleicestershire
Reviews.Content: booked this after feedback from trip advisor and we were not disappointed. rooms spacious and well equipped. the location is perfect. we didn't have a problem with disinterested staff, found them very helpful and pleasant which may mean after comments on this site they have upped their game. we would definitely stay here again, the location is perfect for walking everywhere. breakfast good only one slight criticism the shower was a bit naff not much power. overall big thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Excellent Location (in between Vatican and Colosseum)”
Reviews.Author: Adam D
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location in Rome providing a lovely walk to sight seeing places which are either across or down the river. Rooms are spacious, modern and clean. Think Hilton esq in England. Lovely roof and garden terrace - would be awesome in the summer! Walking to Piazza Navona (15 mins) which is where all the restaurants are!! Breakfast had a great selection and reception staff very helpful. Would recommend. Pity it's quite far from the train stations but you are right in the middle of Rome!! I gave restaurant an average rating purely based on prices. A cup of tea was c£5!! (For a tea bag and hot water... come on guys!)

Reviews.Title: “Jewel in the Crown”
Reviews.Author: travelsforfun2425
Reviews.Content: Located not too far from the Spanish Steps area in a safe part of Rome, this hotel made our stay in Rome memorable. The staff was very helpful and allowed us early check in. The room was 'roomy' with a nice bathroom. Great breakfast spread and the rooftop restaurant is a great choice for dinner. They give green slippers which made our feet happy after the long walks! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A well located hotel and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Mohammed_Fakhri
Reviews.Content: What l mostly liked about this modern hotel was the reception and concierge staff, they were very helpful in guiding me to things to do around Roma and helping me with my tours. The outlets of the hotel were nicely designed and decorated. The location is very good as it’s perfectly located in an area between the Vatican City, the Spanish steps, Piazza del Popolo and other few attractions. People who like to stroll around on foot will love it (if you don't mind walking for 1 km or a bit more). The only thing that I would rank lower is the room. Although it was clean, it was a bit old (at least the one I have been given). Overall very good.

Reviews.Title: “Visconti just different from the "others"”
Reviews.Author: Khangela
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many different hotels in Rome in the recent years, it is fair to say that Visconti Palace is an excellent choice for your stay in the big city. It's located in a nice, quiet area, has spacious rooms, good size bathroom and for Italian Hotel standards, the breakfast buffet is excellent. The hotel is in walking distance from the major sites. Staff in general is very friendly. The hotel has a very nice top roof terras in a modern "design" style.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SlowCooker
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay here. The front desk staff seem very "stiff" but they are efficent and helped us with what we needed, it may just be the way of speaking English that makes them seem uninterested or terse but they did their jobs well and attended to our needs. The rooms have everything you need, nice beds, very clean bathrooms. We liked it that our window could open a bit to let the night air in. If you are in decent physical shape you can walk to just about anything you want to see in Rome from here. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location...but staff is a negative”
Reviews.Author: stafit
Reviews.Content: While visiting Rome, we stayed at the Visconti Palace. This is a good choice, the rooms were clean and beds were comfy. Bathrooms fine and rooms were spacious enough ..considering it is a city hotel and all. We walked to many attrations from here and we found one of our favorite resturant while walking near the hotel. The resturant name is Trattoria Paalazzaccio if you are staying in this area...go there for a great meal and lovely time with all the friendly people. All in all, we were happy with this hotel, except for the front desk staff....they were less than friendly and especially a snippy female who we tried to avoid at all cost. She was downright arrogant. There was one man who was kind and helpful, but that was it. One man promissed to get us a special van for our airport transfer..well lucky for us we found our own because he never did make any arrangements. He said he would put the details in our mailbox..forget it...nothing! If you don't mind not being treated like they are happy you are staying with them, the hotel is a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but could do better”
Reviews.Author: KrisK1957
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good, quiet location within walking distance of everything. We thought all rooms were non smoking due to the way their ad is worded however when we came to book in we were in three smoking rooms. Front reception staff managed to get one of our rooms changed but hotel was full so other two had to make do with what was there. In general staff were friendly and helpful but one of our group thought their room hadn't been cleaned properly - newspapers, open drinks and one of the beds looked as if it hadn't been changed. Reception staff didn't do anything about this and room wasn't cleaned till next morning. I've rated service as very good because apart from this issue it was. Breakfast average buffet style. No variation in hot choice each day but choice of cold meat and cheese, tinned and fresh fruit, cereal and rolls and pastries available so you didn't have to have the same thing twice. Might get a bit boring for a long stay. Rooms comfortable but internal noise can be a problem. Book early online for best deals as advertised price is too high for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and cheap hotel. Good quality and near everything.”
Reviews.Author: lachaplin
Reviews.Content: When looking at hotels in Rome I stubled accross so many in a central location. These were all over £200 per night and were old fashioned and not that nice. I decided to do some research and found this hotel. It didn't seem like it would be near to anything but was cheap. Anyway, this hotel was perfect. It was close to the Vatican and piazza navona (within walking distance). It was also quite near the Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon (slightly longer walk). The staff were very helpful (our aircon broke so they moved us to another room and gave us a free meal on the terrace which was lovely). The rooms were of a good size and the beds were nice. Only downside is no swimming pool, but most places in Rome are like that. If you want somewhere with class and good value then stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, front desk staff as reported....”
Reviews.Author: MJMCH47
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights the beginning of October. Location was superb. We walked to ALL the major tourist sites. Per previous reviews on Trip Advisor I was prepared for the aloofness of the front desk staff....especially one tall youngish woman. Breakfast was good. Porters were helpful. Room was nice. Not much to do at hotel after sightseeing all day. TV was almost all Italian & roof top terrace was booked for a private party when we tried to go up there. Bar off lobby was boring. Slippers nice touch! My husband is wearing his now. Good coordination with HAL cruise line regarding pick ups for ship, airport, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Visconti Palace”
Reviews.Author: sharon214
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Visconti Palace two nights in October and thought the hotel was fine. There was an issue on our first night with a power outage but it made it a little more interesting. The hotel was in walking distance to the Vatican, Trevi Fountatin and Spanish Steps. The bar in the hotel was the only place I got a good martini in all of Italy. Overall it was a nice place to stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “On a good location modern place to stay”
Reviews.Author: c00ker
Reviews.Content: Its a very good structured hotel nearby the Vatican and also the old city. Bus line 70 from central sation Termini stops not far from the hotel. Many restaurants in the surrunding streets.Very good breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Visconti Palace--October 2011”
Reviews.Author: MarBush
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights while in Rome. It is a very contemporary hotel. The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable about the Cities Sites. They spoke very good English. There was a WiFi area in the lobby of the hotel but internet access was being installed in each room and was to be completed by November. The rooms are a nice size and the bathrooms were quite large. You can walk a few blocks to get a bus to the Ceity Central. We also were able to walk to Trevi Fountain and the Spanish steps. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. We prepaid for this hotel and it ended up to be the most reasonable of all our hotels during our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Therese C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Visconti for 3 nights in July earlier this year. Great location as all the sights are within walking distance and just a couple of hundred metres from the bus stop which takes you directly to/from Rome airport in 30 minutes! Our room was big, airy and very comfortable (no tea/coffee making facilities), lovely bathroom. Breakfast was a fabulous buffet, great selection. Although we had read reviews before going that the staff were unfriendly, we didn't find this to be the case at all. Mind you, service on the roof terrace was quite slow but you get used to the laid back style of the Romans :)

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not Bad, But Maybe Better Places”
Reviews.Author: MattyD1329
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night after a cruise so that we could enjoy Rome for one more day. Truthfully I was disappointed with the service and overall hospitality of the hotel. This hotel was much more my wife and I speed when it comes to comforts (although I'm not a contemporary design kinda guy but it was nice) than earlier in the trip when we stayed at a B&B (read my other review), which I never do, and the B&B blew this place away. Check In: We disembarked the boat and our travel agent as well as ourselves confirmed we would be able to check in early (about 1 or 2pm). When we arrived we were told that we wouldn't be able to check in until after 5pm because the hotel was still being cleaned. (Sidenote: they spoke very good English which was good). I have traveled enough to know that early check in isn't always a guarantee but when you call and ask and are told you are all set you should expect it. I'm not so much unhappy about not being able to check in but the way the front desk (2 people a man and woman, I dont have names) treated us as if we were insane for even thinking we could check in, as if this has never happened. They did hold our bags while we went sightseeing but it almost seemed as if it was an inconvenience. Anyway, the location is great...we walked up a road with so much shopping to the Coliseum and the Spanish Steps. I don't feel like the restaurants were as good as the first night but were still very many of them and good. When we did get into our room it was nice. Big Flat screen TV, comfortable bed, roomy bathroom and a small refrig that was stocked but still had enough room to fit some of the waters we bought outside (way cheaper). Checkout was very slow for some reason also. While I don't feel that this hotel is bad or dirty, or bad location, or unsafe...I do feel that for the money we spent we could have most certainly had a better overall hotel experience. Would I stay here again, probably not because I'm sure they're better hotels for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, Good location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our three night stay 14/15/16 Oct '11. The only room moan was only 1 thin pillow each. More were supplied from reception. Reception staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English. The bar staff were a hoot! I'm sure they were sampling their produce. Very funny to watch. It is an excellent position for most of the sights - Vatican, Trevi, Piazza Navona, Pantheon and just walking along the river.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel at Rome's Historic Center”
Reviews.Author: marcelita77
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, nicely renovated with all the modern conveniences. The hotel has an excellent location, very close to Castle San Angelo and nice restaurants. Friendly staff, but it helps even more if you speak some Italian, or even Spanish. I had a two night stay at this hotel. First day my room had a wet carpet that smelled awful. The staff told that the carpet have been recently washed so maybe it was not properly dried. They offered to move me the next day after I came back from my afternoon tour. I went back to the hotel for lunch, to pack my things and for a quick cloth change for my afternoon tour. I was surprised to find out that I have already been moved to a better, fresh clean and upgraded room. I did not expected this so I went through all my personal belongings and everything was perfectly placed. The second night, the blower stopped working. They came immediately to fix it. But It worked for while and stopped again (maybe resistance). So, called again. They brought me another blower that worked fine but had a short cord and got constantly disconnected from the wall!!! Finally, I dried my hair using alternately both driers. Advise: Bring your own drier from home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a couple of days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: watermaster952
Reviews.Content: We found this a very suitable hotel for a couple of nights in room. Nice clean rooms, helpful staff and quite a good location. 10 minutes walk to the Vatican - you're south of the river - through a nice area. Not far by bus from the other sites (Coliseum and Spanish steps etc) - and the buses and good and fun. We used the roof top restaurant one night for dinner - and it was lovely - with good food and a nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “4 night stay”
Reviews.Author: johnnytraveller
Reviews.Content: Location - Although across the river, the hotel was a 10 to 15 minute walk to most of the popular sights. It was easy enough to find although the signage outside wasn't very obvious for a large hotel. Seemed to be on a back street but had the usual busy traffic during the day however it was quiet in the evening. Hotel - Modern decoration and fittings.Reception was business like but not unfriendly. We had a triple room to the front of the hotel which was large enough for 3 full beds and plenty hanging and drawer space. The room and bathroom were very clean with fresh towels and linen (not even a hint of mould in the sealant). Breakfast was very good and had plenty of quality choice. Fresh fruit, yoghurt, breads, bacon, eggs, cereal, coffee, tea, juice etc. all buffet style. Overall good, clean, pricey (but aren't they all in Rome) hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Kathy B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was superbly located, in walking distance of the Vatican and the Spanish Steps. Excellent breakfast, lovely rooftop restaurant with excellent service. The hotel staff seemed aloof, but they mailed a lost item to me in the US, at no charge! I call that excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe 4 star hotel, but 1 star service”
Reviews.Author: Eireann9
Reviews.Content: Booked a 4 night stay at end of September. I'm a regular visitor to beautiful Italy and adore my favourite city Rome. My usual hotel was fully booked up so decided to give Visconti Palace a go based on the mostly positive reviews and the occasional negative review. The hotel itself was OK with comfortable beds and the nice location. My big problem with the Hotel was the shoddy customer service and grumpy ,disinterested and snooty staff. The hotel staff should add to your holiday experience! What a shame for having to pay 4 star money for less than 1 star service. Staff were not the type you could have friendly banter with or find out what currently the 'hot spots' in the city were. Luckily in an otherwise great vacation we discovered a nice friendly Sicilian cafe closeby and beside the cafe was a great chocolateria also on Via Lucrezio Caro. The staff at these two places were so nice and helpful and we found out loads of great helpful hints on Rome. So give Visconti Palace a miss and try other hotels recommended by Tripadvisor. I certainly will not be returning to this hotel and thankfully the bad experience has not changed my love for Italy.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient stop over place.”
Reviews.Author: KT-JKLLim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Rome from 3rd to 7th October 2011, after getting off the MV Queen Victoria where we went on a cruise from Venice, to the Greek historical islands ending in Civitavecchia in Rome. It takes about an hour by land transport to get to Rome from the port of Civitavecchia. The hotel is situated in a central location at Via Federico Cesi 37. If your booked room is ready for occupancy, your check-in would be fast. You have to bring your bags to your room yourself. There are porters, but they were notably absent during our check-in. The staff at the reception is not always helpful, even less friendly some times. Room: We had a room on the 6th floor facing west. In the afternoons, there’s a very bright and glaring light from the sun filtering through the huge floor-to-ceiling glass window. The curtains had to be drawn all the time, not only to reduce the sun’s glare, but from prying eyes from the windows of the adjacent office building. The room size is comfortable and there’s a mini bar, where all the drinks are chargeable, including the Aqua Panna at €4 per 45 cl bottle. Coffee and tea making facilities are not given. The room safe is small, and I could not get my 13 inch laptop into the safe, but my iPad was able to fit in with some manipulation! There’s a Philips TV on the generously long writing table, but all the programs are in Italian. The air conditioner has an effective thermostat and runs quite silently. There’s no balcony in the room. There’s no WiFi in the rooms, only at the reception area and the patio. For this usage, you need to get the code which changes daily,and you are limited to two log-ins for a total use of 30 min. But high-speed Internet connection by wire is available at a fee of €8 for an hour. in the room. There’s a cleaning service daily and occasionally, a turn down service at night. There are many restaurants in the area and it’s not a problem to find places to eat outside of the hotel. If you wanted room service, there’s an additional service charge of €7.00 on top of the food bill. The hotel has a small gym and a roof garden for nightly bar-b-cues. This hotel is walking distance to the Vatican City, the Spanish Steps, the Galleria Borghese amongst the interesting venues. We notice there was a high turn over of guests, and the hotel is almost full daily. Tip: Buy a 1.5 litre of drinking water down the road for €0.90 or as low as €0.18 in some supermarkets, and stock these in your room. You will also need adapters for your electrical appliances, as this hotel does not use the international three pin sockets.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Bug”
Reviews.Author: Patrice H
Reviews.Content: Reasonable rates, great location, walking distance to major sights including Vatican, Spanish Steps, etc. Quiet neighborhood, great shopping nearby. Room clean, contemporary style, can hear neighboring room noise. Breakfast good, rooftop patio nice. Checkout out slow.

Reviews.Title: “Over modern/Great location”
Reviews.Author: marie s
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel by accident and couldn't get our money back. But in Fact was in a great location in that is was less busy by other tourists! More authentic surrounding restaurants than our other stay in Roma. Its a quick jaunt over the river to all the typical tourist areas. Evening walks close by the hotel were wonderful. We ate out at a few little restaurants just a block or two away , and loved them all. Ultra modern decor seemed plain, clean but not a Italian charm..............BUT wait till you have breakfast!!!!!!!!!!! Yes, very surprisingly GREAT...........will not disappoint with variety and freshness! There is a bar in the main lobby and a nice small patio just outside that. The roof top patio was large,slick and modern and I loved this at night, maybe a bit over priced for the BBQ. So I give thumbs up for the pros! even with the overly modern and accidental booking!

Reviews.Title: “Visconti Palace - Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: mack15
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel on our first visit to Italy. After reading all of the reviews on Italian hotels, I had lowered my expectations. I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel with very clean and spacious rooms. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The included breakfast buffet was very good. Our only problems were an annoying water leak in the bathroom that seemed to come through the wall. Also, the air conditioning never seemed to cool down to the room temperature that we were used to. I would still recommend this hotel to future travellers because it was one of the better hotels that we experienced in our trip across Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Carol081
Reviews.Content: Stayed only 2 nights but I found this hotel to be particularly helpful and friendly, very well located and reasonably priced. On previous trip stayed near Spanish Steps paid more than double the price for a MUCH smaller hotel. This location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Visconti Palace - great location but a great shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: Christina W
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 nights at the Visconti Palace Hotel and were very impressed with the location and room but so disappointed with the service from hotel staff. I have to agree with previous reviews - a frosty and disinterested checkin with staff chatting and laughing together and later unable to provide quality customer service for hotel of this 'calibre'. One morning we woken by repairmen hammering on the building facade, outside our window. When we complained the noise did stop but as a crane had to be brought in, surely management could have informed the rooms beforehand (and there was no later apology from management). On our last night in the hotel, after a meal, we decided to have a last drink to farewell Rome in the bar. Despite many attempts to be served and being kept waiting more than 15 minutes and then when a later group arrived at the bar and were served before us - we left. So despite having a hotel in a wonderful location to shops and the Vatican, I can not recommend the hotel due to the poor customer service - and being treated well is all part of the holiday experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: bushbyrne
Reviews.Content: On the Vatican side of the river, which at first seemed inconvenient but it turned out to be a nice plus. At the end of the day is was nice not to be in the tourist areas. Nice Cafe around the corner from the hotel. Rooms are clean and a decent size, but the decor is out dated (from the 80's). Most of the staff were helpful and pleasant, except one person we encountered during our 4 night stay. Breakfast was included in our hotel price and the selections of food to choose from was very good. If you wanted more than 3 channels on the TV they were charging 25 euros per day. As stated in previous reviews, no wifi in room. Hotel bar was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Mai-Lin B
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in early september. We found the staff to be fairly friendly and helpful. The room was very nice - clean and comfortable - i found the pillows to be a bit too firm for my liking. toiletries provided were good quality. Location was quite central to the sights. Breakfasts were excellent with a large, delicious selection of pastries, fruit (both fresh and preserved), good choice of cereals and hot foods - gave us a very good start for the day. There seemed to be noise in the streets until very late as we chose to open our window.....perhaps a different location in the hotel may be quieter.

Reviews.Title: “An adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcos C
Reviews.Content: This a modern hotel in a surprisingly good location (although it is in the other side of the Tevere River, it is within a 10-15 minutes walk from piazza di Spagna, Piazza Navona and the Vatican). The rooms are of adequate size with all amenities you would expect from a 4-star hotel. The bar at the last floor is nice. The furniture is new and the bathroom is big and clean. Weak points: no wifi in the room (and the password you are given to use the wifi in the reception is good only for 15 or 30 mins...), no concierge and most of the staff (with some exceptions) not willing to be helpful. Would recommend the hotel, but with the disclaimers above.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Hotel In Rome”
Reviews.Author: DorannBermuda
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in early September at the Visconti Palace in Rome. This hotel is in a great location. Most tourist attractions you can walk to or a short/reasonably priced taxi ride away. The rooms are very nice, clean, and quiet - a nice size room with an in-room safe. The buffet breakfast was excellent - plenty of choices. The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant all of the time we were there. This is our 2nd time staying at this hotel and if we go back to Rome in the future, we will stay at Visconti Palace again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel however disappointed with Staff”
Reviews.Author: kildare2002
Reviews.Content: Visconti Palace is a great hotel in a fantastic location in a nice quet area. Ideal for walking to Rome's famous monuments and Piazzas and indeed close to St Peters. Hotel is vey clean and also air conditioning is fantastic. Buffet breakfasts are amazing and everything you could possible wish for is available. Top marks for the Hotel and location however the big disappointment is the front desk staff. I got a very frosty check-in and equally frosty check-out. In general I found the staff formal, aloof and certainly not customer-friendly. Also I got conflicting information on check-in about internet usage. Staff seemed to chat a lot among themselves even when assisting you which I found extremely rude. I did also observe during my stay that Italian guests are treated much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: dooleysSeattle
Reviews.Content: WONDERFUL find in Roma. Good Value, great staff.... excellent bedding and facilities. All in all a wonderful week in Roma. This hotel really caters to Americans ( which I could do without as I would prefer the feel of ROMA) but, it has all the services and amenities needed for the two of us who were traveling. The hotel food was very very good! Favorite part of each day at the hotel: late afternoon with a glass of wine on the 7th floor rooftop terrace. You have to serve yourself from downstairs as they don't open til 7PM, but fun and beautiful all the same! Would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Visconti”
Reviews.Author: Delhilondon
Reviews.Content: Good location. Very clean rooms. Reception area is very nice. Rooms are a little more basic but very clean and nice. Very nice and quiet location. Not in the typical touristy locations. But still close to them. Most can be walked to. Close to tube also. Modern.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Very good to Excellent”
Reviews.Author: queenie67
Reviews.Content: Good location, easy walk to Metro. Good, reasonably priced restauarants nearby. Safe neighborhood for nightly walks. Good shopping nearby. Clean rooms and bathrooms, however, beds were not very comfortable. A/C worked great. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Nice bar with most american drinks available. Front desk staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly place to cool off from the heat of Rome in August”
Reviews.Author: carefree_travler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the VP for a total of three days tied-in with a Holland America cruse. Given the cost involved, it was truly excellent. Salient points follow: - it met my wife's cleanliness standards. - the included breakfast was quite nice...if you ask, you can get a capuchin at breakfast, but do NOT try to take food out with you or the smiling man you meet as you enter gets a whole nother look on his face! - the desk staff we're very helpful and friendly. Their answers on good places to eat and how to get there questions were uniformly accurate. They even hooked us up with a nearby pharmacy when it became necessary to have a percription called-over from the States. - the roof top BBQ (which was more of a griilled skewers kind of al than a US BBQ) was way better than we expected it to be. Our server was attentive and the manager chatted us up a bit with local news and bought us each a glass of wine.

Reviews.Title: “very good...”
Reviews.Author: lilymichaela47
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great from the rooms to the fitness centre to the perfect locality to the amazing variety of breakfast choices in the morning. The only one downfall for me were the staff. I felt they looked at us like we were below them because we were a young couple, when in fact they didnt have any idea of anything about us. I felt they would stand and stare instead of being friendly and helpful, at then end of the day we are paying customers and we certainly do not pay to be looked down upon. Other then that everything was very good and if in Rome again would definitely consider returning...if they gave their staff some training on customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: nabila6
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet, tasteful and well-located hotel. It is in the perfect location, in walking distance of all the major sites. The staff is very friendly, professional and accommodating. The breakfast had a good variety of hot and cold food. The room was very clean and nice size. I loved the Visconti and I would definitely go back next time that I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay and excellent service at Visconti Palace”
Reviews.Author: rkvalvaa
Reviews.Content: We were going on a weekend trip to Rome last week and decided to stay at Visconti Palace after reading some reviews. The hotel is about 15 minutes walk from both the Vatican and the shopping areas of Rome. Our room was very nice, the only bad thing were some issues with the TV system. I had my birthday on the Friday, and the hotel got us complimentary sparkling wine with a nice "happy birthday" card. This was unexpected and a very nice surprice. The front desk personell were excellent, always friendly and helpful. Overall a very good stay and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I would definately come back !”
Reviews.Author: Fragi71
Reviews.Content: Room very clean with lot of space. Big and clean bathroom. Daily room service kept the room perfectly clean. Buffet breakfast tasty, fresh and a lot to choose from. Great location, not in the noisy center areas of the city, but in walking distance from the Vatican and with a lot of bus stations to go anywhere. The Wifi in the lobby should be free and not only for 30min. Also internet access in the room with your own laptop should be free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 1superlady
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful going the extra mile to provide service. Rooms were nicely appointed and comfortable. A plentiful Italian buffet breakfast was delicious including blood orange juice. Wifi was available for free. The location made it easily possible to travel about Rome. There is a nice restaurant on site for dining and the area has lots of other great dining spots nearby as well.We would book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff needs an attitude adjustment”
Reviews.Author: Binkley27
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Visconti Palance Hotel after taking a Royal Carribbean cruise. We were booked in the Visconti Palace for three nights. The hotel was centrally located and we were able to walk to St. Peter's, the Vatican, the Pantheon, Coliseum, Castle San Angelo. We found the hotel staff rather snooty (I got the impression that Americans are not welcome there). One observation was that when we had a tour booked, I had asked the genlleman at the desk to let us know when the bus arrived. We had gone downstairs for the breakfast buffet (As an aside, there was no extra charge for the mosquito in the bacon on the buffet). When the bus was late, he acted as though I was being pushy, (the bus was 30 minutes late.) and basically told me to chill and not worry. As it happned, the tour bus company had failed to send a bu to pick us up, and we ended taking a taxi to the bus depot for the tour. On our final day, we elected to check out and have the bellman lock our up our luggage. We had a very early flight out and decided not to book a room for the final night, since we would need to be at the airport at 3:15 AM. A fallacy that one of the hotel staffers told us was that if we went to airport at 3:00 AM, then we could not get into the airport and we would "have to stay on the street." Luckily, this was not the case. While the hotel accommodations were very lovely, I feel that the front desk staff needs to change their attitudues. I work with the public every day, and I know that it can be trying at times, but it is not excuse for not treating others fairrly. Tourists are their bread and butter and the hotel staff needs to realize that.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay here”
Reviews.Author: jmay7777
Reviews.Content: We all really enjoyed our stay here. It is well located within walking distance to most attractions. The staff were always very friendly and the buffet breakfast service very good. The reception team were very helpful and informative and suggested great places to eat. Try the St.Anna, very close by about 10 mins walk and offering a great menu, wonderful service and authentic Italian food. We all agreed that we would use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice trip with a nice stay at ROme”
Reviews.Author: nbl13
Reviews.Content: We have visited Rome last September for holidays and I have selected Visconti Palace for its place and price although I was afraid that it was more businesslikee hotel and for groups too. It surpriced medelightfully because it was better thank expected. Very nice rooms, very helpful staff and a great breakfast! Despite the many groups of tourists who use this hotel, it was very quiet, in a nice neighbourhood. The situation of the hotel is great, you can walk to the river and to many attractions like Spanish steps, and it is very near to a square with many buses which can get you to any place around Rome. In my opinion, the buses in the city are better than the metro, which is very dirty and maybe danderous, especially at the Terminal station, a horrible place... Rome is a nice city, full of history and interesting places. Surely I could use the hotel again both for the value of money and the breakfast which I liked so much!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, very close to the everything”
Reviews.Author: EddieL88
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, 5 minutes away from Piazza dei Populi and 10 minutes from Vatican City and Museum. Clean inside, spacious rooms, elevator and very good buffet breakfast. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: traveler33951
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Viscont Palace with a Globus tour to Italy. This hotel was walking distance to many restaurants. It was also in walking distance to Piazza Navrona and many sights. The lobby had a nice bar which seved sandwiches. The breakfast was held in an attractve dining room and had a wide variety of items to choose from. The rooms were small. but all rooms in Italy seemed to be small. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back next year!”
Reviews.Author: filip00
Reviews.Content: We (3 persons) booked a double and a single room. In most hotels a single room is a very small, noisy room. In Visconti , the single room was great. I got a big room with a big bathroom. Both rooms were very clean, for me that's very important. The staff was polite and helpfull, for breakfast there was a big buffet. The location of the hotel was good. Visiting Rome and staying in Visconti made our trip unforgetable. We will go back to Rome, and for us there is only one hotel; Visconti palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: holly32999
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this property. It met our expectations for a 4 star hotel and was modern and comfortable. The air conditioning worked very well and was much needed in the July heat, better on the 5th floor than the first where we had another room for our teens. The rooms were well appointed, with helpful service. The breakfast buffet was excellent. We very much liked the location and were able to walk to most major sites, with the easy to use metro within reach (a less than 10 minute walk). Would definitely return, and highly recommend Visconti Palace as a solid 4 star choice in a safe and relatively quiet neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Should we stay here or at a hotel on the Via Veneto?”
Reviews.Author: TravelingForFun_2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Rome at hotels on the Via Veneto on past visits to Rome. This trip we decided to stay in an area that would be closest to most major sites, i.e. Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, and of course Vatican City. After checking TA and several other great sources, and reading quite a few reviews we selected this hotel and overall were very pleased. We were exceptionally tired after our overnight flight from the US and were allowed to check in to our accommodations by 11:00 a.m., which was heavenly. We stayed for 4 nights in June. My husband, our niece and I shared one room, which made things a bit crowded, but workable since we only showered and slept in the room, spending most of our time sightseeing or eating at various restaurants. We did peek in at the roof top barbeque and it smelled and looked great. The hotel’s concierge personnel were very helpful. Several of the front desk personnel were wonderfully responsive (Thanks again to Carla!). We really enjoyed the breakfast each morning and were happy with the variety of foods available. A terrific way to start each day. The hotel is modern and clean. The beds were on the very hard side and the room air conditioning works, but like my previous experiences in Rome, does not cool as well as I am used to. The bathroom and the toiletries were first rate and very much appreciated. However, the room hair dryer required me to keep the button held down when in use, so I was glad I brought my own, with an adapter. The mini-fridge worked fine and kept our bottles of water cool. Interestingly the in-room television, which also served as an internet connection, was pay-for-use, so we didn’t. We used the no-cost Business Center’s single PC, located downstairs from the lobby, next to the hotel’s breakfast room. The hotel’s location, the responsive staff, the terrific breakfast and the hotel’s cleanliness are reasons we will return to the Visconti Palace on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller-Bajan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Visconti with family and friends for a few days in July and here are the pros and cons I found. PROS: (1) The hotel is within walking distance of restaurants and shops. You can also walk to the Vatican and the Spanish steps from the hotel. (2) Free bedroom slippers are provided in the rooms (3) The hotel has a decent breakfast on mornings (4) Rooms and bathrooms are large, basic and clean (5) There is a mini gym if you would like to work out CONS (1) Expensive. You have to pay for every little thing at this hotel (2) The staff are efficient but aloof. They are not very friendly (3) There is no iron in the room forcing you to pay for the laundry service if you need to iron (4) The walls are thin so you can hear the noise your neighbors make Given the cost of this hotel, they could offer more amenities to guests and not charge for so much but overall it is an ok hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility, but my least favorite”
Reviews.Author: DuraMater
Reviews.Content: Very "modern" style, clean and well maintained. Staff when we checked in were less than friendly. Different staff on duty when we went down to report stopped up sink, very accommodating and sent someone up right then. We were late checking in because our train was four hours late arriving because of a fire in one of the stations and we had to adjust our dinner plans. Kids really wanted their last dinner in Rome to be pasta and pizza but everyone was so tired, we didn't want to go out walking around so we ate at the hotel's rooftop restaurant. Very beautiful locale, but no pizza or pasta, an "I Love BBQ" Italian style menu. Food over-priced, (no good reason to order "BBQ" in Italy). Menu was confusing and limited. An expensive disappointment. Breakfast was good and they accommodated our early departure. I totally love the coffee and hot milk program!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MemberToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise. The room was clean and comfortable with a modern bath. There was also 30 min of FREE internet daily accessed in the lobby. The hotel was close enough to walk to most of the major tourist sites in Rome. Although the hotel is located in a quieter neighborhood, at no time did we feel it was unsafe. The front desk staff were both polite and helpful when approached for any questions and they spoke/understood English. The breakfast was decent with lots of choices and was a handy way to start a busy day. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very competent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Noashcloudplease
Reviews.Content: Our family was comfortable in the suite with main bed and a sleeper couch for our two boys (9 and 11) in an adjoining room. In a few years they would be too big for the double bed they shared. The hotel is well situated - 15 mins walk from piazza navona and on to the main historical sites. Colliseum is quite a way - best reached by bus but the vatican area is within walking distance. The location is quiet at night and its a benefit to be slightly away from the big tourist areas. The hotel is modern and very efficiently run. We found the service efficient but cold. It was not proactive. One night we were there was a major public holiday for the city of Rome featuring a fireworks display at the nearby castle St Angello, but this was not mentioned at all. Our impression is that its orientated to tour groups and business travellers, not individual tourists -- anyway, as long as you know what you want they are happy to arrange things. Dont miss a visit to the Trastevere area. Breakfasts were excellent, room was clean, anything we needed was organised. We had a rental car delivered to the hotel, which may not be possible elsewhere in Rome, for our trip out to Tuscany. The drive was exciting..a GPS is essential. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “stay elsewhere !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Slayridez06
Reviews.Content: family of 4 on a road trip through italy.......this place was the WORST !! 1. we were told at check in "the room has a safe - be sure to use it" ....... unfortunatley, we couldnt fit all of our stuff in the safe......so some things went missing.....they told us to deal directly with the local police......... 2. both rooms stunk like dirty feet - all 3 nights 3. Valet told me 25 Euros per night to park the car......at check out they charged 45 euros - PER NIGHT........and would not even discuss what i was told by the valet 4. Someone - assume the valet staff??? - used the vehicle while it was "parked" - found clothing left in the car - assume the valet staff??-- most of the fuel had been used -- and the rental ID "keychain" was missing from the keys. 5. Most of the staff were rude and aloof 6. spend your money somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “BELLA ROMA, HOTEL FANTASTICO!”
Reviews.Author: GEORGINANYC19
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience I had at this hotel. The staff went above and beyond to help me out at every turn. I visited family while in Rome, and got stuck one night at my cousin's house and could not get a cab back to the hotel. Riccardo, at the hotel, arranged for a car service to pick me up and take me back. Well beyond his duties, he saved me! When my 90 year old father needed to take a train to Bel Aria to visit other relatives, Francesco went online and downloaded the train schedule for me, both going and returnng to Rome. Besides the exceptional service, the Visconti Palace staff made me feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and a Great stay”
Reviews.Author: DaveCambs
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Visconti Palace - great location near to the Vatican and within walking distance of many of the major sites. Its a more modern Hotel tham many others in the City Centre and so wasnt as attractive from the outside - but inside its is decorated very well and the room was large and clean with AC. Has its own fridge where you can keep your own bottles of water cool. Breakfast was great! Cereals, pastries, fruit, yoghurts, drinks, juices etc. Some items once run out were not replaced though such as the Lemon Cake. The roof terrace is very nice with waiter service where you can either relax with a drink or eat. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: hgaur
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel which was not very far from Vatican. This hotel completely met our requirements. The metro station is also close by. The staff of the hotel is always eager to help. One of the friendliest people I have ever met. As per Italian standards the breakfast was fairly reasonable. I will surely recommend this hotel to everyone coming to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Love to stay in this area of Rome - great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CoTravelsalot
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Visconti Palace - the last 20 yrs ago! It is still a great hotel. Totally remodeled and very modern - great rooms, nice bar, gym and very welcoming. It is about half way between the Vatican and the Spanish steps close to the Tiber River. The area is very safe and has many shops and restaurants. The area is more residential and not at all crowded with tourists. Not cheap but what good hotel in Europe is. The included free breakfast is a great !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDDBS5
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of Globus tour "Best of Italy" Nice modern hotel. Excellent bathroom. Powerful hairdryer. Individual AC control in the room, but I think they shut it at night so if you want to be cool through the night blast it before you turn in and never raise the thermostat!. Very nice buffet breakfast. Not a far walk to Piazza Navona/Pantheon during free time.

Reviews.Title: “Great, modern hotel. Beautiful rooftop lounge.”
Reviews.Author: Kari908
Reviews.Content: Ask for a room that ends in "01" because these are the largest on each floor. The BEST room in the hotel is room 701. It is the rooftop room and MUCH larger and more modernly updated than some of the other floors. Room 601 is nice, too. The price includes a nice breakfast each morning. The staff is friendly and the hotel offers wireless in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & good location for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Munch09
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience for Visconti ...remember that hotels in Rome are never the same as their star rating - they are small, old fashioned and over priced. The Visconti is a great find in Rome! The staff are friendly and helpful - although don't book sighseeing tours with them, go with 110 Rome (red bus tour). The rooms are small but clean and modern, breakfast was great with lots of choice & again staff very friendly, once we got our bearings the hotel is in a great loaction. I do agree with previous reviews that the windows and walls are not soundproofed - we could hear the next rooms argument for a good few hours!!!! but i never ever travel without ear plugs - travellers tip no1! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...added to our Rome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueen2121
Reviews.Content: The Visconte Palace was perfect for a romantic vacation with my hubby. Hotel staff was nice and very helpful. Always mapped our way to touristic sites and off the beaten path restautants. Our suite was a very nice size and contained a large bathroom with a nice sized living room. The bed was a little on the hard size but nothing a little wine didn't take care of. The hotel is trendy and very modern. Very nice cozy bar and sitting area near the lobby. Hotel has a nice continental breakfast every morning with bacon, eggs, cereal, etc. Roof Top Terrace is very romatic. Hotel is within walking distance from Piazza Del Popolo and the Spanish Steps. It is also within walking distance from the Vatican, Ancient Rome, and Fontana de Trevi. We walk a lot back home so walking everywhere for us was no sweat...specially having those nice beers and prosecos along the way. I will definately stay here again when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and misleading website pictures”
Reviews.Author: calmont
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely overpriced. I have stayed in rome twice before and have received a more extensive range of amenities Service is awful. Staff are condescending. I asked about a balcony as described on their website and I was told "only in suites and they are so expensive" The shower didnt work properly only boiling hot or freezing cold and it took over an hour for someone to try and fix it. All in all I would not recommend this hotel. Book elsewhere you will get a better room and much better service. I would suggest some customer service training for all the staffr!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'm not sure if Visconti is a 4 star hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: petrosthess
Reviews.Content: I think Visconti isn't a "Palace" :) .Is a very good 3 stars hotel and definitely isn't a 4 stars. The carpet in the room was dirty, the bathroom had mold and the worst was that i had the feeling i was sleeping on the road (soundproofing was terrible).
