Breakfast was good, service poor and "The breathtaking roof-top lounge terrace with a panoramic view of the city..." lol.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Room For Improvement”
Reviews.Author: wineonthego
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have just returned from the VP,we love Rome and this location,this hotel has a beautiful terrace,shame it was poorly serviced,there were ashtrays left dirty for 2 days also some full of apple cores. The rooms are ok not 4 star, no tea and coffee,and the TV was poor,basically sky news, the rest you had to pay for,was very noisy on 2 nights, several dogs barking well into the morning,I don't suppose it is their fault,but it was there. The main reception staff were very friendly and helpful,but I am afraid I cannot say the same of breakfast staff,2 were extremely rude,there was also food left on chairs from previous diners,one morning we witnessed a pile of cake and large pieces all under the table,new people were sat there without any clean up. The drinks were very expensive,2 rum and cokes 26 Euros,1coffee and 1 bottle of peroni,11 E. We don't like moaning about issues and all in all we had a wonderful time,I think at 200 Euros pn we expected a little more,you also have the new Govt Tax e3pppn,we have holiday'd in Italy 6 times last 3 years,it is pricing itself out for us . If you are coming here to this hotel and landing at Ciampino,the taxis will try to charge you E50 ,you could ring the hotel and they would arrange for you at e30,or the shuttle bus e8pp,nice little family restaurant,Ristorante Roma, just before Ponte Cavour,other side of river

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: capekodder
Reviews.Content: At first I thought that the hotel seemed out of the way but it was really not. We were very please with the hotel and the room quality. We travelled with our kids and needed 3 rooms so this provided a balance for us. It was clean, rooms were a good size and it was not ridiculously expensive. It was about 10 minutes from the vatican, 10 minutes from spanish steps, and other sites. We were very pleased with our choice of this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Maja05
Reviews.Content: I have visited Rome in march 2011 with my friend. We visit Rome every year. The hotel has a a great location. It was only 10 to 15 minutes to the shopping center of the city and 10 to 15 minutes to the Vatican. Thus we could do all the sightseeing on foot. The hotel is clean, has nice spacious rooms and the breakfast was good. The staff was really really nice. They also suggested us some good restaurants (hidden gems) and made our stay in Rome even more beautiful. We will definitely come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “A must stay...”
Reviews.Author: TMP313
Reviews.Content: My three day stay at the Hotel Visconti Palace added to the memorable time that I spent in Rome. The neighborhood is extremely safe and very accessible to all tourist attractions. The Spanish Steps and a plethora of shopping are a leisurely 15 minute stroll away. The staff was very helpful and recommended 2 great authentic Italian restaurants - Da Enzo and Vito's - both within walking distance of the hotel. You will not be disappointed if you stay at his hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: cdke
Reviews.Content: Pro's - decent size room, nice bath, fabulous breakfast, free 30 minutes internet daily, apples at the front desk, easy location to walk to Vatican, Pantheon area Con's - flat old pillows, water temp fluctuates, not a lot of choices of nearby restaurants (and had a horrible experience at Le Cupola so avoid them at all costs) 2 blocks south there is a Pizza Kebob on the corner - great price for pizza/calzones, kebobs and beer. Next door to that there is a small market - great for cheese and wine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ilovesunshine87
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in march-april 2011. The hotel was spotless with large clean rooms. Breakfast was excellent with tea/coffee, a large selection of fruit, cereal, pastries, rolls, yoghurts as well as cooked breakfast. Within walking distance of many if the sights including the vatican, trevi fountain, piazza del popolo, spanish steps, designer shops along via condotti (along and around via del corso also has nice, more affordable shops) and just a few streets from piazza cavour where you can get the bus to other locations including the colosseum. The staff were very helpful and always willing to give directions or information about what bus to get where etc. We flew to ciampino airport and there was a bus directly outside the airport that took us to statione termini for 4euros (different bus company on way back 6euros). From there you can get the subway (1 euro) from statione termini to Lepanto station and its around a 10min walk to the hotel. Overall Rome is a beautiful city had a great trip and would definately stay at the visconti palace again!

Reviews.Title: “great choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: broadwaybelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend on a 'girly weekend' for 2 nights in March. I would recommend the hotel based on the following - modern hotel, very clean and quiet - reasonable sized room for a city hotel (we had a deluxe which had extras like bathrobe/slippers) -good location, quiet as just over the river, but easy access to everything on foot ( via Veneto 30 mins walk, Piazza del Popolo 5 mins walk) -safe area, we felt safe as 2 women walking back to the hotel from Via Veneto at midnight -very pleasant staff, any requests were actioned immediately and with a smile, and the staff were knowledable -rooftop terrace would be a definite advantage during summer, it was warm enough to sit out in the evening even in March, but maybe we were just lucky! (no bar service up there at this time of year but you can take drinks up from the lobby bar) -free safe in room - good choice at breakfast including some hot items such as sausage/bacon and scrambled eggs, and plenty of everything A hint regarding transport from the airport, we paid 4 euro each one way on the Terravision bus that drops out at Termini station (approx 1 hour journey), from there you have a long walk or metro/bus to hotel. We bought a hop on/hop off tour right outside the station that lasted for 2 days at 18 euros each and used that to get to the hotel and then for the rest of our stay too! When travelling back to the airport we decided to take a taxi direct from the hotel, this cost 40 euros one way (took 40 mins), and we were pleased we had as some people in the boarding queue behind us had used the bus back and had made it by the skin of their teeth as the buses were so full they could not get on the one they wanted so had to wait for the next one, so if you intend to use the bus back to the airport leave PLENTY of time! any questions, feel free to ask...

Reviews.Title: “Fresh modern hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Archie067
Reviews.Content: We were a bigger party that stayed at Visconti palace for 2 nights. I can definately recommend this hotel: Positive: - Good location to everything. - Clean, fresh and modern. - Good breakfast. - Probably great terrace on the roof (it was raining when we were there). - Nice rooms. - Professional reception staff. Only negative: - Hard beds.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good, but few small issues”
Reviews.Author: al_oz79
Reviews.Content: pros of our stay - location is great, deluxe room was good size for europe, clean, good breakfast. most of the staff helpful and a plesent way Cons of our stay - tv, worst system in any hotel i've seen, internet via tv kept cutting out, the movies jumped and skipped. like watching a scratched dvd or the that hard drive couldnt keep up. was pretty much unwatchable. ( yes we are on holidays but sometimes at night you just feel like relaxing, after watch only news channels for 2 weeks in english) some staff were a little rude when asking for some info on tickets to attractions. no tea coffee in room so was charged 4 euro for a glass of milk at the bar. overall nice place, but i'll be looking else where next time.

Reviews.Title: “Small but unique”
Reviews.Author: salkg69
Reviews.Content: On the outset the hotel looks very small as its built on a corner. However the rooms are built around such a nice view and were just perfect for our week trip. Location was ideal for walking, taxi service, and restaurants and shops. Perfect example of Rome, absolutely romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern Hotel close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: LindsayLCubed
Reviews.Content: The continental breakfast buffet here was by far the best we've had in all of Italy. They have a huge selection of food and drinks! The room was somewhat small but clean and modern. The bathroom was fine except for the teeny tiny shower that always overflowed. The internet is not free, that was a downfall also. Otherwise, it was a fine hotel. Nothing special, but when you are in Rome to sightsee and only stay in the room to sleep, it's perfectly serviceable. Good location too, a lovely walk along the river to Trestavere, and a short walk to the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern Hotel in the Heart of Roma”
Reviews.Author: Rengs30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Visconti Palace as part of a tour group and will stay here the next time I am in Rome. Its location is perfect for exploring all Rome has to offer. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the hop on/hop off bus tour which brings you to all the famous sights of the city. The rooms are modern and comfortable. There is a great fitness center and the complementary breakfast has a great selection of traditional european as well as american breakfast foods. There is an awesome rooftop patio where you can enjoy a cocktail or two amongst the beautiful lighted planters while gazing at St. Peter's Basillica. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: digitalje
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights. It was in a great location to access all of the major sites in Rome. It was in walking distance to the Vatican and to the Pantheon and Piazza Novana. We also were near the Metro, about a 10 minute walk. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The green slippers were an added bonus. Our one complaint would be the cost of the Internet access. We were charged 15 euros a day which was a complete and utter rip-off. My husband was presenting at a conference and needed to stay in touch with this students in the US. The cost was totally inflated. This also applied to the TV. You could upgrade to 24 euros a day to watch TV and get access to the Internet. At that rate, we would have expected a high-speed connection, which it certainly was not. Web sites took a long time to load and Skyping with family at home was not successful using video.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: TaffCardiff
Reviews.Content: A comfortable hotel with efficient and very helpful staff. Situated in Prati, not too far from the Vatican and Saint Peter's and an ideal location for walking to most of the main sites. They do a good breakfast too!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4star hotel”
Reviews.Author: elena_greek
Reviews.Content: Instead of staying at Piazza Di Spagna as usual, we chose this hotel at a more typical Roman residential area near the Vatican.We were close to all our favorite piazzas and shops while at the same time enjoying a most pleasant stay at a 4star ++ hotel with its spacious rooms and great breakfasts.Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: zinval
Reviews.Content: It's a modern hotel in the heart of an ancient city. Very friendly, very central (don't get confused becase its location on the other riverside). The room was a Superior Double in the 7th floor. Very nice and big room exactly like the internet photo. The bathroom was very clean, almost as the room's size. The design was modern giving you the appropriate relaxation. There was also a balcony exactly like the internet photos with the purple light above the sunbeds. The breakfast was very delightful. The staff was very helpful at all the times for all the matters (about the hotel, about the city, about the public transport). There was no wifi and no free internet. The hotel is located by the river, 1 min walk from pz Cavour (buses to pz Navona 87, 70), 7 mins walk from pz Popolo, 10 mins walk from metro st.Lepanto, 20 mins walk from St. Peter Vatican. It is appropriate for romantic or business travel. We like it, and we 'll definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: UK_Yank83
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Visconti Palace. Bottom line. it's a solid 4 star hotel. The staff was excellent, the location was top notch, and my Rome experience couldn't have been better. We had two little kids and were given a larger corner room. The free breakfast was great (esp. the coffee and pastries). The location near Piazza Cavour is perfect, as you can get a bus for 1 or 2 EUR that will take you to the Collisseum and Forum. We easily walked (with a 3 yo and 10 month old) to Piazza di Popolo, the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and Piazza Navona. The Vatican was a very short walk, and the nearby Castel Sant'angelo is well worth seeing. There are also some excellent restaurants ranging from very expensive (The place across the street, it's costly, but DO IT if you want a great meal) to your standard family-friendly Roman pizzeria. I can't say anything against this hotel and will return when we visit Rome again next year to visit what we couldn't get in this time.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Comfortable and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Luther15
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a few days over the Christmas Period sight seeing in Rome and we stayed at the Visconti Palace Hotel. What an excellent choice we had made, nothing had been overlooked and the staff were all helpful. After several holidays in Italy, the breakfast selection at this hotel would take some beating and for a self service it was a relaxed atmosphere,not previously experienced in large hotels. We only had one evening meal in the hotel, which we both enjoyed and compared to other establishments was reasonably priced. Drinks like most hotels are expensive six euro for a small bottle of beer. Public transport was limited due to the Bank Holiday period, but this is no problem from this hotel - On Christmas Eve we walked to St Peters for Midnight Mass and Christmas Day we walked to Castel Angelo, Piazza Navona, The Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps and back to Piazza Del Popolo for something to eat. Boxing Day (St Stephens Day) we used the "hop on hop off" bus to go to the Colosseum and then sight seeing by night. A great experience at a great hotel. We would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: Parf
Reviews.Content: Arriving late in the evening after a long day, I was pleasantly surprised by the warm welcome at check in. There was no problem when I didn't want my bags taken to my room for me and the receptionist couldn't have been more welcoming or helpful. In my 2 nights at the hotel I never saw even one person waiting for service in reception; the staff all efficient, knowledgable and friendly. My room was excellent, better than the Radisson I usually stay in. They expect you to pay a fee for cable internet access, but that's normal for Italy and the fee isn't extortionate. The hotel's breakfast is excellent. It's located close to a square from which a number of bus routes operate and quite close the centre. The Vatican is a 15 minute walk, the Spanish Steps are 20 minutes away if you avoid window shopping on the way. All in all I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but characterless”
Reviews.Author: CBEGocek
Reviews.Content: The Visconti Palace has a good location and works well if you are not expecting anything other than a slightly faded modern hotel catering for short-stay tourists and business people. There was nothing wrong with it, but it did lack a certain ambience. Breakfasts were good and plentiful and a snack lunch by the bar proved invaluable on our day of arrival. Internet facilities were inadequate and frustrating. We managed to walk to all our points of interest apart from the Colosseum and Ancient Rome. There were good restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Well Positioned, Modern”
Reviews.Author: Raynboz
Reviews.Content: I liked it. A short walk to everything. A nice room, and quite spacious and modern. A fantastic breakfast included. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for short stay”
Reviews.Author: btricciardi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in August 2010 and the location was pretty good, within walking distance of all the sites. We had two rooms, 1 adult,1 teenager to a room. Very quiet at night, but have a nice rooftop deck to sit and enjoy a glass of wine. The rooms by European standards were a good size, nice modern bathrooms. Most of the personnel were accomodating but extremely slow!!!!. We got a great package through expedia, so the price for the value was great. Would stay here again. There are not many restaurants in the general area which was one of the downfalls of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesomer than Awesome.”
Reviews.Author: buttercrunch2
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Very helpful staff, simple clean rooms with beautiful bathrooms, A+ breakfast buffet, lovely rooftop restaurant, great wee workout room. Even the waitstaff was charming, especially Ambra. I found the location perfect as it was just far enough away from the hustle and bustle to be more peaceful, but also close enough to walk to many tourist hot spots. And who wouldn't want to be walking around Rome as much as possible anyways? I even met a great gal in the gym one morning and we took a jog in the neighborhood at 6:30 a.m., felt very safe, and had the amazing experience of jogging by the Vatican and St. Peter's, which we had all to ourselves at that time of the day. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, especially as it is such a wonderful deal for the price. In fact, I dream about it. :) (Oh wait! One minor complaint. Please play more Italian music over the loudspeakers. It's no fun listening to so-so, remixed, atmospheric American pop in a foreign country. Just my personal opinion.)

Reviews.Title: “Birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: Kerry-Liam
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until the moment we left the staff were excellent towards myself and my wife.Reception staff were always there greeting you with a smile and very very helpful when asking about going to places and even booked our bus city tour for us. As it was my birthday I was away for the hotel left a bottle of champagne in my room for my arrival and a card from the manager. Maybe pricey drinks but where else in the world would you get cheap drinks in a 4/5 star hotel.Very high standards throughout the hotel.Fitness room has up to the day fitness machines and spacious too.Restraunt staff very helpful as were the concierges.If going back to the city I would definately check the availability of the hotel before trying ours.Good situation for visiting the Vatican City.As we had private transfer to/from the airport and never once used the Metro/public transport we cant comment but the taxis were excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable - a good base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: challenger08
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Visconti Palace. There were some things we really liked, but a few things we didn't. Public areas were great - modern, contemporary, clean, bright. The bar, roof terrace and seating areas outside were all really pleasant. Our room was very spacious with plenty of storage space and a well designed bathroom with a decent shower. The location was good too - just over the river Tiber and in a residential area but very close to shops, cafes and restaurants. The staff were unfailingly helpful and efficient. There was internet access in reception which at 5 Euro for 30 minutes was fine. Breakfast was served downstairs in the 'basement' and was good - wide range of continental items, plus a few hot items. What didn't we like? The hotel was a bit noisier than we would have expected - people in the corridor tended to sound like they were in the room with us, despite only speaking in normal tones. The TV was poor - only one or two stations unless you wanted to pay 25 Euro - which we didn't. Beds were very firm indeed, and although this wasn't a problem in itself, the provision of only one thin pillow each was disappointing. Overall it wasn't a bad place to stay, and we might consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “EASY and Smooth”
Reviews.Author: mcar906270
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed here years ago and told us it was great! They were right. It's located not far from San Pietro and Piazza Cavour and Piazza Risorgemiento< So you can say that we walked a lot but we wanted to because it was all close. There staff were great!!!Also, very important, they had gluten free food for me since I am a celiac who suffers from this gluten intolerance. So if you are GF you are good to go here. Very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for exploring the city centre”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryMark42
Reviews.Content: Room: Comfortable and quiet. Air conditioning effective in my room despite hot and humid weather. Had all the facilities I needed for a couple of nights in a tour group and after a long flight. Meals: Breakfast buffet style was excellent. Other meals were elsewhere. Location: crowded part of the old city, but even so the bus could get around. Parking for everyone seemed to be poor. Excellent base for walking from. Liked best: Location & comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in a quiet part of bustling rome.”
Reviews.Author: JoBugger
Reviews.Content: Good middle of the road hotel. Made use of the stay for 3 nights pay for 2 offer which worked well for us but we had to pay in advance. Location: The hotel is situated far enough from the busy streets but is only a short walk across from Piazza del Popolo and via del Corso and close to the Vatican as well. One block away from the busses and 4-5 blocks from the subway. I wouldn't recommend using the subway from Termini though...way too many stairs to walk up and down with suitcases. It would be better to use a taxi from the airport OR take the train to Termini and a taxi/bus from Termini to the Hotel. Service: Hotel staff were average, not bad and not great. They were helpful and told us what we needed to know and check in/out was quick. Room: The room and bathroom was clean but basic - no frills, but we expected that. Bed was not very comfortable but good enough for a few hours rest. Breakfast: Was included in the room rate. Not much to speak about - cereals, croissants, eggs, etc. Good enough for a quick meal until you can get some pasta or pizza for lunch. Overall, its decent for money, but no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisAkabusi
Reviews.Content: I can only echo most of the other comments on here about this hotel. Great location to visit all the major attractions in Rome, including the Collussium, which is probably the furthest away. We walked everywhere, didn't need to use the public transport once. Hotel is friendly, clean with decent sized rooms and offers a decent buffet breakfast to set you up for the day. Whilst there we also went to the roof top terrace for a drink and some food, which again was quality and highly recommended. For price, location and quality, i think you would struggle to find better in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Marleee
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel. Nicely decorated. Staff was very helpful with questions and suggestions. Location was great, we walked every where. Bus stop is a few blocks away. Room was very clean, shower was small. You have to pay for WiFi: 5 euros for 30 minutes and you don't get connection in the room, just in the ground floor. The bar and patio are very pretty and relaxing, we spent some time there having wine. Taxi ride from airport was around 45 euros, and to the Termini was 10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: UnViajeDentroMexico
Reviews.Content: I can really recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to do a city trip! It is very central, in between the vatican and the historic center! You will be able to watch every single sight by foot because everything is so close. The hotel rooms are totally clean. The entrance area is bright and really comfortable. The receptionists speak a lot of languages (e.g. english, spanish, italian, german) and are very nice. You will have a good breakfest buffett (in comparisson to italian breakfast which is generally not that good). All in all - the hotel is really worthwhile a stay for anyone doing a city trip!

Reviews.Title: “The Visconti Palace”
Reviews.Author: Andrea417
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay while in Rome. There were many great places to eat within walking distance. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Rach1832
Reviews.Content: Having recently returned from a 5 night stay at Visconti Palace Hotel in Rome I wanted to share my views and experience with other prospective travllers about this hotel. Whilst the hotel isn't the prettiest from the outside it is modern, clean and very pleasant inside. The reception is smart as is the bar area and outside patio. The star of the show is the roof top terrace which is stylish and modern. The views from the top are fantastic, the chairs are comfortable and you can enjoy al fresco dinning should you desire. We ate on the terrace on one evening and throughly enjoyed it. It felt like a private dinning experience as we were initially the only customers for the first hour so had first class service and excellent food which was good value for money. The room we stayed in was a reasonable size with a massive bed which was extremely comfortable. The air conditioning was very welcome and was very effective in keeping the room perfectly cool. In fact the whole hotel was pleasnatly cool at all times - very welcome after the heat of the day! Breakfast was excellent with a vast array of options. It was a buffet so you could have as much as you liked and literally fill up for the day if you desired. The location of the hotel is exactly as described on the website. You can be at the Vatican and other nearby attractions within 10 mins & Piazza Novona is also only around 10-15 mins leisurely walk. We found it very easy to navigate our way round the city from the hotel which also helpfully have maps available at the reception. I would definately recomend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome. It is a quality hotel which I consider to be good value for money. My partner and I would definately stay here again on our next visit to the beautiful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tomuchofagoodthing
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 4 night stay at the Visconti Palace and look forward to returning on our next visit to Rome. We picked the hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is modern, clean and very friendly staff. We were travelling as a family of 5 (three children under 14 years old) and were given rooms next to each other, after emailing our request in advance. The bedrooms are modern and the beds comfortable. The bathrooms were on the smaller side but this wasn't an issue with us. The buffet breakfast was very good with no problems of choice for the children. The hotel was ideally located on a quiet street yet within easy walking distance of the central attractions (Piazza Navona in 15 mins, Piazza del Popolo in 10 mins) as well as St Peter's and the Vatican. We would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value + great location”
Reviews.Author: re67
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last 2 nites of our Rome holiday. It was welcome luxury after the heat of our villa in Abruzzo+ the aircon alone is worth the money. The rooms are well equipped but not all have a bath so you will need to request a bath if you want one (we had a shower only) Breakfast is fantastic + best the we have had in Italy. We had a bit of noise from some neighbours in the nite but managed to get back to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel Close to Major Sites”
Reviews.Author: godawgsfah
Reviews.Content: The Visconti Palace hotel was the first hotel of our 3 city vacation in Italy. It is well situated within easy walking distance of all major attractions in central Rome. We walked to the Vatican, Coliseum, Forum, Pantheon, Spanish steps, Trevi fountain and other sites within 30 from this hotel. The rooms are decent sized with comfortable beds and somewhat small bathrooms. Air conditioning is strong. The rooftop bar was nice after a long day of travel. Dining nearby was okay, but nothing to write home about. The breakfast provided with the room was very good with eggs, meats and lots of fresh fruits. This seems to be more of a business than pleasure hotel and it has a very modern/contemporary european atmosphere, but for a home base close to what we wanted to see, it was an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel,friendly staff,great location”
Reviews.Author: HalifaxCasper
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from the Visconti palace, we will be certainly returning.we have visisted rome 3times prior but this is definetly the best 4* we have stayed in.The hotels location is in the nicer area,less tourist than the busy ares surrounding the major sites.But all major sites within walking distance,the Piazzo Navona is approx 15 min walk away. The terrace on top of the hotel is lovley and the food highly recommended. All the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The transfer we arranged with the hotel were excellent. Whether its your first or returning to Rome,the hotel is an excellent choice,very claen,modern and very comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Hotel in a Nice Quiet Location - But Still Close Enough Everything”
Reviews.Author: NapesandLisa
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Visconti Palace Hotel. The majority of staff are pleasant and relatively helpful. The standard room we had was small but very comfortable and had new comfortable beds. The breakfast was great with an excellent selection on offer (even including Soya Milk). In our opinion this hotel is ideally placed to explore the major attractions in Rome, as these are only a short walk away. We would stay at the Visconti again.

Reviews.Title: “Just 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Noelehua
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great area. Short walk over the bridge to good food and the shopping. A local area.. No air conditioning until June 1 and it was getting hot in April. 26,2010. They will not turn on the air and they had a lot of complaints about it being hot at night.. A lot of tours stop at this hotel. Breakfsat was above average. Most Italians have an attitude of don;t me by asking questions The staff not to helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, modern hotel fifteen minutes walk from St Peters and Piazza Navona”
Reviews.Author: Autumnaldave
Reviews.Content: We chose the Visconti Palace for our four night sightseeing stay as other reviews had said it was quiet and just out of the main tourist area. A fair way from the Metro with our luggage meant that a car back to the airport was far better value for money than public transport. The hotel is excellent, everything you could wish for in a smart four star city hotel. The rooms are modern and quiet, the bed surprisingly comfortable, which for me was the greatest plus point. The cafe spacious with a huge variety for a buffet breakfast, including hot crispy bacon and egg. The staff were helpful, the public areas quite swish. We could not have been more impressed, and will definitely stay there when we next visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Well maintained modern hotel, Quiet location, Short walk from main attractions”
Reviews.Author: DaveandLauren
Reviews.Content: A fantastic quiet location situated just far enough away from the main hustle of the city, yet still within a 10 minute walk of some of the main tourist attractions in Rome such as the Vatican, Piazza Navona & Pantheon. My partner and I stayed at the Visconti Palace for 3 nights at the end of April and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The Hotel staff are friendly including the hotel car driver who took us back to airport. It is clean and has all the mod cons you expect from a good Hotel. The continental breakfast was good and catered for all tastes. The only disappointment we had was that the beds were a little firm but as we were both so tired from cramming as much sightseeing in as possible over our short trip we didn't really notice. Overall a great Hotel and we would stay there again when we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PaulDAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Knowing in advance that hotel prices in Rome are really expensive, I chose this hotel because of location. It is a short walk to St Peters and the Vatican, Piazza Navona, Piazza del Popollo, etc. Having stayed in Rome quite a few times I prefer this location over all others as you have immediate access to great shopping, great food and the usual attractions of Rome. The major benefit is that the shopping in the immediate area is great (Via Cola di Rienzo), without being over run by tourists in the area of Via del Corso. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a large suite on the 7th floor (as we were on our honeymoon). Within 5 mins a bottle of Processco and food was delivered, compliments of the management. The staff were great, the breakfast buffet excellent. Rooms are spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfortable. The terrace on the 7th floor was one of the best that I have seen in Rome. I would gladly pay a small amount extra to stay at this hotel than save 50 euros a night to stay in one of the many sub-standard hotels in this city. I notice that others complain about 'attitude'. I suspect they haven't been to Rome that often before. Once you understand how the city works and how you achieve what you need to, it is actually very easy. We will always stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb freindly hotel for a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: Lise81
Reviews.Content: Hi We were two 28 year old girls on a four day vacation to Rome. We both loved Visconti Palace for various reasons. First of all the staff were very polite, except for one of them. Our favourite was Roberto A. We received great service and they aswered our questions willingly although we did have a lot of stupid questions. Secondly, the barstaff were also superfriendly. Normally I don't really stay in the hotel to have a drink late at night, but with nowhere open nearby we had a great time in the hotel bar. Third, the room was immaculate. Thick curtains so one gets to sleep in complete darkenss and thick windows to keep the sound of traffic out. We got plenty of clean big white towls and the bathroom was filled with soaps etc. The hair drier was a bit slow, but not a major problem. The hotel is close walking distance to the vatican, Piazza Navona, Pantheon etc. We didn't use public transport once. I truly recommend Visconty. Lise-Norway

Reviews.Title: “Perfetto!”
Reviews.Author: MY30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel with friend of mine. We had a great stay. The Staff was really nice and very helpful. At the reception we received great help from one of the staff member called Roberto A. He was always smiling when he saw us, and helped us with whatever we needed. Even though I asked him a "stupid" question, he answered politely! He recommended several restaurants for us where we could have a good meal. One of the restaurants he recommended called Cesare had great food and service! We also got great service when we were sitting at the hotel bar! The location was not bad either, it only took 10 minutes to walk to Piazza Navona. What can I say? We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel - many many thanks to the nice staff there :) I wil definitely go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not as great as we expected!”
Reviews.Author: tlf82lab
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the reviews on here. Overall, the Visconti Palace was pretty good, but it was no where near as great as the previous reviews I had read. The hotel was very modern and clean. The lobby/lounge area was very inviting and we did enjoy a nice glass of wine there one night. The room was spacious for European standards, clean and modern - although it wasn't overly attractive. The bed was basically two twin beds joined together and was about two feet off the ground. It did get a little warm in there but not too bad. The first night I slept with the window open and was woken up a few times due to noise - trash pickup, etc. The other nights we just chose to sleep with the window closed. Probably a combination of all the things mentioned above - but I did not sleep well at all while here and seemed to be up most of the night. The breakfast was pretty good although there were not many hot items. My husband and I found enough to keep us full for breakfast. The front desk staff was not particularly friendly. They did not greet us when we would go in and out, not even a simple hello. It almost seemed like we were bothering them sometimes with our questions (which weren't much - where to buy train tickets, can you make us a dinner reservation?). As far as the location goes, it wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. We did A LOT of walking and were often tired in the afternoon. To come back to the hotel during the day wasn't always easy. It is pretty close to the Piazza Navona and Piazza del Popolo. Overall, I'd recommend the hotel but not if you're looking for a prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: Douzen
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Visconti is NOT a Palace”
Reviews.Author: AsiaWise
Reviews.Content: We have just returend froma 3 night Stay over Easter weekend in Rome - Visconti Palace. Admittidley it wasn't our first choice in terms of picking the hotel in the first place as we organised this trip only 10 days before going and the hotels we identified as out first choices were all full, so eventually through TA help we picked the Visconti. Pro's: Location is OK, if you enjoy walking and the weather is good, the location is fine. The hotel is clean and the rooms are clean and fairly modern, but not an attractive modern or a likeable modern. Con's: Breakfast is terrible, nothing good about it at all to report, there are a few OK cafe's near by so that was our workaround. I found most of the staff just unhelpful, not rude apart from one guy on the front desk, but in the main just unhelpful. The Air conditioning is not switched on until peak summer and the windows only open 2 inches so the rooms even in Early April are excessivley hot. I reported this daily as it genuinely did affect my sleep, i was awake with noise from outside from having the window open and the heat fo the room was too much for me personally - no manager or staff member was helpful with this matter, simply told, Air conditioning isoff in hotel until it is hot. I went on to explain that it was a feature advertised as a room feature so that i felt duped by then checking in to find it wasn't available. On my third and final night they eventually found a fan that i requested daily, this was better nothing but the controls were broken, buttons missing off fan controls so i couldn't set it up as i would have liked to. In summary if the air con was on and worked and the breakfast was overhauled then i think this would be a genine 4 star hotel contender, and of course some refersher customer service courses for some of the management and staff wouldn't go a miss. I will definitley be back in Rome but hopefully not at the Visconti Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern and a pleasure to stay there”
Reviews.Author: TwigsOxford
Reviews.Content: We have just spent four nights at the Visconti Palace Hotel and were very pleased with our choice. Nice room not huge but spotlessly clean and had everything we needed. We were asked on arrival whether we would like one bed or two and the bed was large and comfortable. Breakfast was fine, not much hot food but a selection of fruit, cereals, yoghurts, cold meat, cheese, cakes, bread, jams etc. You help your self to juice and coffee. The hotel is situated in an area with a few shops and restaurants nearby and with easy access to most of the must see places. It was very close to Castel St Agnello and the Vatican and just over the bridge from Piazza de Poppolo. We walked everywhere and didn't use public transport once. One restaurant that we liked was Alle due Fontanelle just a few hundred yards from the hotel. I would certainly choose this hotel again when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to the action, but in a peacefull location.”
Reviews.Author: NickandNess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Visconti in April 2009 and I should have written a review then. I was recommended the place by the travel agent, and then looked at the reviews on Trip Advisor. It clearly scored well with others and so i booked up. The location is perfect. After a days site seeing we could walk across the Tiber and leave the hustle and bustle behind and enjoy a quiet location to get some much earned rest. Then in the morning back over the bridge and within 10mins you're at the Spanish steps. The hotel staff were lovely and the breakfast was great. The room was a lovely size as was the bathroom. It was very clean and had the full range of extras to make it feel upmarket. We stayed for my partners birthday and she loved it. It was the perfect base to explore Rome from.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: millomite
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a Rome hotel two years ago that did not come up to expectations I was hoping this one would be different. It certainly was! The hotel is modern, clean, comfortable and the staff exceptionally helpful. The bar is lovely to sit in and enjoy a glass or two of wine and the snacks they provide with drinks are varied and tasty. Its location is perfect for walking into the city and has very little traffic noise at night, unlike most inner city hotels. In the surrounding streets there are numerous little restaurants and cafes although not all can be recommended. The Chinese restaurant near the hotel (Hang Cheng?) is to be avoided, poor service, poor food and expensive. Don’t be put off by those calling themselves Pizzerias because they will have more than pizzas on the menu. The pub/bar/restaurant in Piazza Cavour is worth a visit for the friendly staff and well stocked draft beers. Finally don’t allow the waiter to decide which wine you want, as happened to us in one expensive restaurant, stick to your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Visconti Palace”
Reviews.Author: GeriP2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location. Walking distance to the Vatican and St. Peter's Basilica.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home!”
Reviews.Author: sarasotasiren
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there three times and never have been disatisfied. The hotel desk clerks are very helpful and 4/5 times a cab was immediately available. Close to the Vatican and Borghese Gardens. Try the Blue Grotto Restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Love to go back and stay here!”
Reviews.Author: bearfanRockford_IL
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful, modern, well located. The maid service was outstanding and the room was always cleaned by time we returned. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and well stocked. My only complaint was that the hotel advertised free slippers and robe. We got the slippers but no robe. I just assumed the robe was no longer offered so I never asked but I see its still listed on their website. Sent an email but no answer yet. Otherwise, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and charming staff”
Reviews.Author: 4MR
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a package tour with a sports travel agency. I didnt have high expectations because we were on a tour but it was fantastic. Our rooms were large, clean and quiet with lovely (although not huge) bathrooms and the hotel even left a complimentary bottle of excellent wine in our room. Staff were charming and helpful - nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was extensive (although I thought the quality of the pastries could have been improved on) and delicious. The hotel has excellent facilities including a gym which was totally deserted so I had it all to myself! Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Second Trip wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Teachertraveling
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Rome where we stayed for 5 nights at the Visconti Palace. I have stayed here before, and it was my husbands first trip to Europe. I was very pleased with our visit and the hotel. We found that although the hotel is not in the middle of tourist land, it was worth the 5-10 minute walk. Every night we were able to walk away from the insanity of the tourist areas and retreat to our quiet little "home". The breakfast continues to be great-this time around (as opposed to my first visit) there were eggs and bacon available every morning-mu husband enjoyed them! I tend to snack on the cereal, yogurt and fruit for breakfast. The self serve coffee was great and my only disappointment was the lack of attention from the servers-last time I was there as soon as I sat I was asked if I wanted an expresso etc...this time I was only approached once. The room was very comfortable-we felt there was enough room for the small amount of time we were actually in it (to sleep and nap). The bathroom was of sufficient size as well. We had issues with the computer in our room and the staff was kind enough to let us use one of the hotel computers. They also arranged car service to the airport for us. All in all I would still recommend this hotel to friends and family. It is close to the Vatican/St.Peter's and a 10-20 minute walk to most other places! Thanks Visconti, for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Room top view - Under used ! So I enjoyed it all to myself! Pleasant and helpful staff, always!”
Reviews.Author: mytriptorome
Reviews.Content: I traveled solo to Rome in mid October - Meeting up with family elesewhere, later ! I enjoyed my room and the roof top lounge though it was under used. Which was fine with me, I enjoyed the peace, quiet and the view, both, day and night. I found the staff more than helpful, especially late one evening as I was lost walking back and called the desk continuously for directions to get back to the hotel. Two blocks north, make a right, three blocks more, etc.... They even offered to send someone out to locate me and get me back !!! Of course my family back in NJ, USA was not happy with me out there in Italy, LOST !!! When I did finally get back to the hotel, I was greeted and welcomed back, I enjoyed a late night snack at a table near the bar, with personal one on one service. It was a pleasant experioence. The morning buffet was truly enjoyable, though two mornings they did ran low on some of the basics - eggs ! But there was plenty to choose from! I did not like that several days they had closed off the outside and inner areas due to a private affairs. I had paid for use of the hotel not just some areas ! I had meant to confront them about this and ask for a refund or some adjustment. All and all it was a clean, nice place to rest and relax. I did throw coins in the Trevi Fountain three different times will I was in Rome: So I hope I will be back to Rome and I would consider staying there again though it was a little pricey !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...bargain”
Reviews.Author: travelboo22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location (once you find it-we got lost). The vatican is less than a 10 minute walk away and everywhere else is in walking distance. The hotel is beautiful when you walk in and has an amazing roof terrace which I am sure would be great in the summer. The staff were all very helpful and attentive and provided us with a great map! Our room was clean which was great. it looked like there had been a leak as the was a patch on the wall which looked like someone had fixed it quickly. There was also a smell of cigarettes on the corridor but we couldn't smell it in the room. The breakfast offered something for everyone! from pastries, cooked breakfasts, fruit and cereals it was great. It is on a quite road but it takes 10 minutes to get to the spanish steps with is a great place to people watch and it is nice to come back to a room where it is quiet enough to sleep after a long day of sight seeing. I booked the hotel using their own website. I had a few problems so I emailed them and they were so helpful that I was able to book in over email. It was €300 for 3 nights and breakfast which is amazing for rome! It is very difficult to get a decent hotel near such a main attraction for such a good price! Me and my partner would stay at Visconti again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jojo10Dubai
Reviews.Content: We had read reviews before booking this hotel and they were all very good however, i do not think they did this little gem justice. All be it Visconti is not a top notch hotel, the rooms are very modest although mordernly decorated but it was in a perfect locations, with friendly staff and we had a very comfortable stay. The beds are large and very comfortable, the rooms are big enough for two people and however much luggage you may have. The breakfast in the mornings was very good, catering for all tastes, however we did not eat any other meals in the hotel as it was a little pricey compared to some the pizzeria's and restuarants near by. The staff are very friendly and if you need things booked they are happy to do this for you. In all honesty we did not spend too much time in the hotel but it was perfect for what you need when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “nice amenities, location not so great”
Reviews.Author: NJNewWife
Reviews.Content: this hotel had great amenities, was very modern, and had a delicious and large breakfast buffet. we stayed here on the last stretch of our honeymoon. i would definitely suggest it for younger travelers who like to walk alot, it is over a bridge from the main part of Rome, however it is close to the Vatican. It was in a central spot for us since we wanted to visit both, but it was not on a street with much activity.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: TeamRandR
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was fantastic, staff was very good, and the room was nothing special. It was really irritating how much they wanted to charge for Internet connection (15€ / day). The location was not perfect, but everything was within 2 miles which we found walkable. Overall it was a good value (less than $175/day).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at Visconti Palace”
Reviews.Author: margaretandgraham
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in early November on an excellent Expedia flight and hotel deal. VP hotel came up to all our expectations, based on previous Tripadvisor reviews. We had a standard double on 4th floor at rear of the hotel - very queit, as requested. Decent size room with spacious well equipped bathroom, incl full size tub with powerful shower over. Comfortable (firm) large double bed (two twin mattresses pushed together, as is common continental practice). Room was nicely furnished and kept spotlessly clean throughout our stay. Ample storage. Comfortable room temperature (early Nov) and large window can be opened if necessary. We always read in bed at night and usually have to struggle due to inadequate light; however at VP we were particularly delighted with the bright mini down-spotlights in the uplighters by the bed. The included self service buffet breakfast (in the large pleasant basement cafe) was exellent, with a wide hot and cold choice which was kept well topped up. We usually ate around 8.00am in order to make most use of the day in our busy schedule. VP also has a nicely furnished and stylish lounge and bar, which serves light snacks later in the day and evening (soup, sandwiches etc). However, it is a 4star hotel and prices were a bit steep for Britons suffering from the collapse of the Sterling exchange rate against the Euro: 6 Euro for a small beer or glass of wine! We thought the location of the hotel was ideal, just across the river on the Vatican side and with easy access to all the sites, either walking or by bus from Piazza Cavour (5 min walk). Bus No 87 takes you to the Colosseum in c15 minutes for 1 Euro! St Peters Basilica and the Vatican Museum are a comfortable 15-20 min stroll from the hotel and many of the popular sites on the other side of the river (Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps etc) are an easy stroll. But take the bus for the Colosseum / Forum as that is a fair walk from VP and you will do lots of walking when you get there. The area around the hotel is relatively queit with a few restaurants and cafes to choose from for evening dinner. We found a lovely cellar restaurant only 200 metres down the street from the hotel: Alle Due Fontanelle (www.alleduefontanelle.com) offered a delicious three course dinner with wide choice of starter and main course for Euro 18 per person. And that also included bottled water, house wine and coffee. Staff were very friendly and it was so good and convenient we ate there three times. We would thoroughly recommend the Visconti Palace hotel for a comfortable, conveniently located good value break in Rome. Pre booked (via Expedia) shuttle bus transfers from the airport to the hotel and return worked without hitch. We visited all the main sites and lots of churches. As first time visitors to Rome we were overwhelmed by the architecture, history and art . A particular highlight for us was the Vatican Museum, which includes the Sistine chapel at the end of the mandatory route. But don't rush through the many rooms and halls of the museum as there is so much amazing work to see - allow three hours for the whole visit (plus St Peters afterwards, so needs a whole day!) The restoration work on most of the ceilings and the masterpiece whole wall paintings is fantastic - showing the original clean bright colours. In addition they are for the most part well lit, particularly the ornate ceilings, which makes a tremendous difference. Only natural light is allowed in the Sistine chapel but it is awesome. The Vatican Museum is worth booking ahead online to avoid admission queues. You pay a small premium to do this but worth it. We booked ahead using the official Vatican website, which allows you to print off a specific timed admission voucher. Similarly, we booked ahead (through Expedia as part of our package) for the Colosseum and Roman Forum.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, good location, safe neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: lilio74
Reviews.Content: We were relieved upon arrival. The hotel was nice, clean, and modernly updated. It has the slight feel of a big chain hotel, but on a smaller scale. Plenty of attendants at the front desk, all looking sharp and professional. By American standards, not the friendliest; there is an air of snootiness coming from most, with the exception of one or two at best. The buffet is decent. The coffee is delicious!~! cold cereals, pastries, canned fruit, yogurt and deli meats. Their eggs are SCARY looking. Actually, everything on the hot table is. I must say though, the dining room attendants were all very very nice. The room was typically small, but very very clean. Newer furniture, bedding, carpet, bathroom, bidet.... all in excellent condition. We had some honeymooners next door, and so we (my mom and I) found out how very thin their walls are! Beware if you're checking in with kids. While there is a computer in the lobby with internet service, it does NOT work. I paid 5 euros for a 30 minute ticket, and was only able to compose email; couldn't open my email, and the system kept freezing. They said it was non-refundable. The neighborhood is nice, and several piazzas are within a 10-15 minute walk. A bus stop is a 5 minute walk away. Noises aside, we would probably stay here again.. next time we'll ask for some quiet neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Marzeemo
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. I found the staff to be extremely helpful, professional and friendly, including the front desk attendants and the bartenders. The rooms are large and very clean. It is a modern hotel in walking distance to many main sites. There are many wonderful restaurants located within walking distance of the hotel. Every restaurant that the staff recommended was wonderful. The breakfast buffet was large with lots of different choices.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodPortland
Reviews.Content: Located just on the other side of the river near the Former Hall of Justice, this hotel is in a very good location. You will spend less here than for something comparable near the Trevi Fountain or Piazza Navona. The front desk staff was superb, the bartender not so much. It's a newer structure (thus very clean) surrounded by some great eateries. Although you come to Rome or the Italian food, there isn't much diversity if you occasionally crave something else. Very close to the hotel is a superb Japanese restaurant. The breakfast was better than expected. Lastly, I don't mind paying for the Internet, but I wish they had a terminal in every room or more than one in the lobby, given that it's a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Large, clean rooms in decidedly modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaymfab
Reviews.Content: The Visconti Palace is an excellent option for your stay in Rome. It feels very Americanized, so it's great for business travel, if it misses the European charm. The rooms are downright huge by European standards, queen beds, nice work space. The hotel staff speaks excellent English, the included breakfast buffet is very good. You can walk (10 mins or so) to the Vatican and Spanish steps, and there are tour bus stops close by. Having been to many European hotels, I found this one to be incredibly comfortable, even for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value”
Reviews.Author: Alan26
Reviews.Content: This was the 4th time staying at Visconti Palace & since the first visit when we were very pleanantly surprised , the hotel has never disappointed. Rooms are good size & exceptionally clean. Breakfast good & staff always helpful & polite. The hotel situation is ideal with all major attractions wihin walking distance. I'm returning to Rome in February & am already booked at Visconti. Unless something goes seriously wrong I would not consider satying anywherelse in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Jane'04
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Visconti Palace. It's located in the Prati district - a nice quiet neighborhood, but an easy walk to the Vatican, Piazza Navona and Piazza del Populo (in fact, we even walked to the Colosseum one day). It's also only about a 10 minute walk to the Metro. The hotel room was lovely and the breakfast was delicious and lavish; even though we've stayed at a number of hotels in Italy, the spread still impressed us. The staff was extremely helpful. Although we arrived very early in the morning, we were given a room immediately. We had reserved a king bed, and were directed to a room with twin beds. When we told the manager, he apologized profusely, and sent another worker to accompany us to a second room to make sure that it was correct. The Visconti has now become our preferred hotel in Rome; we recommend it highly

Reviews.Title: “Five-Star Experience for Three-Star Prices”
Reviews.Author: SampleTheCulture
Reviews.Content: We booked the Visconti Palace for 4 nights in Rome, and it was one of best international hotel experiences I've had. The staff was extremely helpful and polite. One hotel staff member helped us plan tours in Rome, as well for our visit to Florence. The rooms were extremely spacious and immaculately clean. Even the bathroom offered marble counter tops and one of the cleanest showers I've seen. The location was perfect as well, as we were only about a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, St. Peter's and a metro stop. There's a bunch of lovely cafes situated around the hotel, which also offered a convenient place for a morning cappuccino. We ended up with a great deal, as we booked the hotel room through Visconti's website and received a free night's stay. I would highly recommend the Visconti, and will definitely be staying there on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, location and visit”
Reviews.Author: cs29
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, the best we had during a trip throughout Italy. Good location with 5 mins walk from the Vatican City and 10 mins from central Rome. Wholeheartedly recommended and good value for money. Check the hotel website for good deals.

Reviews.Title: “Visconti was a real pleasure for us. we'll recomand it by all means!!!”
Reviews.Author: HifaSavta
Reviews.Content: We came to an unknown place and immediately felt at home. The welcoming smile on the face of the nice people at the dining hall, the help we could always have from the people at the desk, the nice clean tidy room we have met every day - all together gave us the wonderful filling of home and supporting on our tour and staying in the great interesting, full of grace and beauty - Roma. we left the Visconti Palace with the dream and promise to be back to Roma and to this hotel. For those who are looking for a good pizza at the end of the day, close to the hotel - Vito's is the best . once you'll meet the place - for sure you'll come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sjbk
Reviews.Content: We did a post Silver Sea cruise stay for three nights at the end of August and were delighted by this hotel. This is our third time in Rome, and we enjoyed this hotel the most of our past three hotels. Comfortable, quiet and a good value. Rooms were a decent size, good bathroom area and air conditioning worked well. Breakfast in the morning was quite nice and service was pleasant. Doorman always got our taxis for us and it was easy to get around to all the sites. We did alot of walking, which was great for taking off the cruise pounds and my parents, both in their 70's kept up well, even in the warm August days. This hotel is easily accessible to the Vatican and surrounding areas. Only a $6.00 Euro ride to Plaza Novona, Trevi Fountain and Plaza Espana areas, but when we were there, traffic was light. Two gems for dining: Ristorante del Pallardo - need a reservation and is truly an Italain home cooking experience that brought me back to the days of when my Grandmother and Grandfather hekd Sunday dinners. This is a set menu, truly affordable, whatever they are serving that day, wine included. They made us feel right at home and well worth the adventure of finding it ( we walked from the Pantheon, using a map) . Just down home italian cooking. Le Cupole - only three blocks from the Visconti, this other family run restaurant was also another gem and a true italian dining experience at a good price. Cannot wait to go back to Rome. Threw my coin in the Trevi Fountain, as it worked the last two times!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at the Visconti and even more impressed than before!”
Reviews.Author: dreamvacation1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from another pre and post cruise stay at the Visconti Palace and I have to say I love this hotel even more than before. The location can not be beat, the staff friendly and the accomodations immaculate! The breakfast (complementary) was great and plentiful just like last time. We stayed one night pre cruise in a mini suite which is the same type of room we had before, very large and spacious which I posted photos of in the past. For the two nights post cruise we stayed in an executive suite and you would have thought I died an went to heaven! The suite was HUGE- really the bathroom alone was bigger than some cabins I have seen on ships (the total cabin). When you enter the suite there is a sitting area which they brought up a bed for my son to sleep on. This allowed us to still use the couch, desk and entertaiment area. The suite was stocked with two flat pannel TV's a Bose entertainment system (where you can listen to music in the bath if you wish) tons of storage and a stunning view from the huge balcony. The next room over is the bathroom which was divine! Seperate marble shower and tub, toliet and bidet and large counter and sink area. The scale was actually nice to have as we weighed our luggage before check out and found we had to move things around. The master bedroom is very large, has built in closets and more drawer space than I have ever seen in a hotel before. There are three sliders to get out to the huge balcony which is the ulimate place to enjoy a beverage from the well stocked mini bar and watch the lights go down over the city.The lights are hidden in the bonsai trees and beautiful when lit. I can't say enough about this hotel- except I hope to be back again next summer! Here are updated photos of the suites- definately worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “good location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: MediaProf
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in July 2009 -- the location was excellent, about 15-20 minutes from the Spanish Steps and 20-25 minutes to the Vatican/St.Peter's. It is definitely a modern hotel, with a plush reception area and sharply dressed staff (though I found them to be rather cold and distant). I was moderately disappointed by the room, however, as it in no way looked like any of the images contained on the hotel's website in terms of decor. It wasn't a bad room, just not aligning in any way with the promotional literature of the hotel. Calling the decor that of an average Holiday Inn would be about right. The bathroom was nice and large, however, and fully functional. I felt as though the air conditioner could have been stronger, even though it was on full blast. The Continental breakfast was fine, with everything seeming to be quite fresh. There was a large tour in the dining room when I was there, so it may be a favored spot for the larger tour operators. One downside to the stay was that a guest in one of the adjacent rooms decided to watch his television on the highest volume setting at 2am. This necessitated calls to the front desk, which dispatched a staff member to deal with the situation. Although it was handled well by the staff, it was not fun to lose an hour of sleep in the middle of the night. I'm not sure I would stay at this hotel again. Maybe for a quick one-night stay it would be fine, but any longer than that and i think the minuses would start to overshadow the plusses. Hint: if arriving at Roma Termini (the train station), definitely take a taxi to the hotel -- it's a quick jaunt, and well worth the fare as opposed to hiking across Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A modern hotel with some pluses and some minuses”
Reviews.Author: PJBEssex
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying at this hotel with my daughter. In spite of the rather austere exterior, we found the common areas of the hotel to be bright and spacious but our 'standard' room was quite disappointing and not a bit like the illustrations on the website. In fact we felt it was more Travel Lodge than a 4* hotel! Nevertheless the room was very clean although not particularly large. Also, in spite of other comments on Trip Advisor, we found the location was quite a walk from the main attractions, being on the equivalent of the 'left bank of Paris'. My advice is, when looking for a centrally located in Rome, pick one in the 'inner circle' if you prefer not to do too much walking in what can be very intense heat. One real plus was the excellent buffet breakfast, as good as we have had anywhere. Lots of choice and plenty of really good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CumbriaMole
Reviews.Content: This large hotel is located between Piazza del Popo lo and the Castel Sant'Angelo approx 5 mins walk from each. Easy to get to from the main station by metro line A getting off at Lepanto station. The hotel is very clean, we had a large room on the 5th floor 524 the room was spotless and cool from the air conditioning on arrival and over looked the quiet street below. No noise could be heard from the street or other adjcent rooms. The breakfast selection was fantastic as were the staff in the breakfast room. All of the hotel staff we encountered were very professional, friendly and keen to help if needed. We really enjoyed our 4th vist to Rome and this was largly due to the hotel we sayed in

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: wallinia
Reviews.Content: We book this hotel last minute for a very good price. We were upgraded to a fantastic room on the seventh floor with a large private terrace with sun beds and a huge spa like bathroom. We were celebrating my husband's 35th brithday and were on arrival served a complimentary bottle of champagne and strawberries free of charge. The room was very clean. The breakfast ok but nothing special. The hotel is walking distance from all of the main sites except Colloseum and Forum romanum. The only negative is that the reception staff was not so attentive. This is a very good hotel and we will stay here again next time we come to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: andycrosson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Visconti Palace hotel from 19/06 to 23/06 2009. The hotel is situated in a predominantly residential area to the west of the Tiber close to Castel St Angelo. The pictures of the outside of the building on this site and on expedia have been photoshopped a little, the external facade is a bit dated but the interior is reasonable. I booked through expedia and got a good rate which averaged ou at about £90 per night which given the location was the best rate that I could get by miles. The location is great: 15 minutes walk to St Peters 10 minutes to Piazza Navona 10 minutes to Pazza del Popolo Most of the popular tour buses stop either at Piazza Navona or St Peters. The hotel has good sized rooms with comfy beds and big bathrooms (the tub was ok size but a little small for soaking). TV is an old style CRT screen with limited channels but I wasnt in Rome for the TV! This was my first trip in Europe, I usually go to the US, but I felt the hotel information within the room was lacking, most hotels have brochures or folders explaining the facilities - the best source of info in this hotel was the advert within the lift The roof terrace is great with plenty of seating space and good sun until 7pm at night. The communal areas are reasonable - the bar is pretty small and bar staff were not very friendly, the food and drink was expensive as it seems to be everywhere in Rome. The included buffet breakfast was very good, plenty of choice. The front desk staff weren't particularly friendly on the day before I checked out I asked if there was a computer that I could use to print a boarding card for the flight and was told I could use the TV based system within my room, when I tried to explain that there was no way to print from this I was met with a blank look, I also asked if the hotel were able to book transfers from the hotel to the airport and was told they could book a taxi or private car only, no shuttles,etc. Given previous experience of dodgy taxis within Rome i decided to use the nearby Metro station to transfer to the main Termini stazione (1 euro) and got the da Vinci Express (11euro) The housekeeping staff were excellent. I had the choice of staying here and a couple of more business orientated hotels on the outskirts of Rome and while being close to the attractions was nice, if I booked again I would be tempted by cheaper rates more facilities (e.g. pool) at the other hotels. Positives: location beds bathroom roof terrace breakfast housekeeping Negatives: price of food & drink bar and front desk staff dodgy advertising pictures communal facilities (no pool, small bar, no real restaurant) poor hotel info in room

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ucfe
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in Rome for the price and the location. We chose it based on previous reviews in tripadvisor. This is a modern, clean, comfortable, and conveniently located in a quiet neighborhood close to the Vatican. The rooms are very cozy, quiet, big and clean . Bathrooms are spotless and spacious with a good size tub. The breakfast was amazing with great service (they make you any type of coffee you like at no extra cost!). Staff at the breakfast room was extremely friendly and greets you with a smile and a nice "buon giorno". This hotel is perfect if you don't mind to walk. It is about 15 min. walk to the Vatican and about 30 min. to the Spanish steps. I don't recommend you to take the subway since it is one of the worst in Europe (dirty, unsafe and limited routes). A few blocks from the hotel you can find nice shopping and good choice of restaurants not for turists. Rome is extremely overpriced so avoid eating at places near attractions since food is terrible and way too expensive. Avoid sitting in the outside tables since you will be charged 12% plus there is a minimum consumption. Hight speed is extremely expensive. At the end of the long day of sightseeing it was nice to come to relax at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great breakfast, but misleading advertising for children”
Reviews.Author: balkangal
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reviewing many, many places as we were looking for the most central location for our long weekend in Rome but one that would be open to children. This place sold us when we read they offered milk and cookies, bathrobes for children, babysitting, and books -- sounded like the perfect place for familes.....on a high note, the breakfast was excellent, location was perfect, and the rooms were very clean. BUT on the down side, we were two days into our trip and never saw any of these amenities and finally called downstairs to inquire. It only resulted in a coloring book left for us after the cleaning staff cleaned the rooms. Also, we asked for a sitter in advance and was offered the daughter of one of the hotel staff who did not speak English. We decided not to go this route as we did not want someone caring for our son who could not call us and communicate if there was an issue. We were dissappointed they would offer this service on their website and not have something more professional set up. Also, to have rented a business suite and STILL have to pay 15 Euros/day for internet seemed ridiculous to me. Service was very slow -- whether it was getting the DVD player to work or calling for extra blankets, we had to usually call twice. The staff was friendly but that doesn't excuse the poor service, and the fact that I had to wait 30 mins in the lobby after a long flight b/c my room wasn't ready even though I had emailed well in advance to tell them I would be arriving early. Would likely stay again in this area but at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location west of historic centre”
Reviews.Author: MaryGCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day weekend trip and the Visconto Palace Hotel is what you would expect for a 3 plus - 4star hotel ( Irish Standards ) Fully air conditioned, spacious rooms, clean, friendly front desk staff ( not a norm apparently in Rome). Fresh bed linen and towels each day and comfortable beds. The hotel is located on the west side of the Tiber River, 5 minutes walk from Castelo de Angelo, 10 minutes walk to St Peters square and 10minutes walk to Piazza Popola across the bridge in the historic centre. Located in an area which appears to be a business area, a few shops, cafes , restaurants adjacent to hotel. All land mark sites within an easy 20-25 minute walk. Bus to city centre close at hand from Piazza Cavour, 15 min bus ride to Colosseum. Buffet breakfast , hot and cold , scrambled eggs, bacon , cold meats cheese, freshly squeezed orange juice, choice of bread rolls and pastries , very good generally only negative point is the coffee ( personal taste love lavazzo and coffee was not good) Free apples at reception to keep the hunger pangs away. Contemporary roof terrace with comfortable sofas which serves buffet lunch in the afternoon, cannot comment on the lunch as did not sample it our selves but other guests did. Taxi ride to Fuimincino airport €47-50max ( set by authorities in their licensed whiote taxis).

Reviews.Title: “clean,modern and friendly”
Reviews.Author: pua1964
Reviews.Content: the visconti palace is modern clean and friendly hotel,we stayed bed and breakfast.the room was cleaned every day to a high standard.breakfast had everything from a choice of fresh fruit to scrambled egg,bacon etc.the staff at the hotel were all verry helpfull and always friendly.stayed with my wife and parents and we would not hesitate to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great accommodations”
Reviews.Author: taylor130
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights, a quick vacation in rome. We were able to walk to all the sites and resturants. The breakfast is so complete that we forgot it was lunch time. I can't think of anything that the hotel could do to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellersHarrogate
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 4 days at the Visconti Palace with my husband and two friends. The hotel staff were pleasant and efficient. The barman Luca gave us a few tips on getting around and we had fun with him at the bar. The rooms were very clean and spacious with very big beds. Breakfast was buffet style and beautifully presented. It is within walking distance of The Spanish Steps, The Vatican, Trevi Fountain. We would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “nice modern well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: dermotty
Reviews.Content: visconti palace is situated on the vatican side of the river tiber in quietish office type location.only 15 minutes to spanish steps and similary to vatican.hotel modern,staff friendly and rooms quite nice.only negatives are internet facility and recomended local restaurant called vitos which was decidely average.overall positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Visconti !!!!”
Reviews.Author: papula65
Reviews.Content: As part of a pre transatlantic cruise package ,my husband and I booked a 4 day stay at the Visconti through Carnival Cruise Lines . The hotel exceeded our expectations! It was well situated within walking distance to major sights including the Vatican Museums and St. Peter's. The hotel staff was personable, professional, and helpful. The room was spacious and well equipped and the large bathroom was spotless.
