The breakfast buffet that was served in a large lower level dining room, included a variety of choices of food and beverages. The service was excellent! I would definitely stay there on my next trip to Rome

Reviews.Title: “not bad except for a few gliches”
Reviews.Author: travelinshoesnh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Visconti Palace in Rome over the New Year. The Hotel said they had internet through the TV but it cost $10 a day. The internet access was clunky and I could not read or send emails using the TV setup. My girlfriend wanted me to point out that there was no fan in the bathroom, I would note there was no heat lamp either. Another downer, we had a shower which was a disappointment given the amount of time we spent out walking in the rain, it would have been nice to come back to a nice bath, something you would have expected from the city that invented baths. Besides these issues, the Hotel was nice, our package came with a continental breakfast buffet in the morning. The staff was helpful and we got the spare pillow about one half hour after asking. I would go back again now that I know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: treasuresgirl
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our three nights at the Visconti Palace. Our 5th floor room was ultra clean and comfortable,and more spacious than we anticipated. The bathroom was also clean, spacious and had nice amenities. One slight complaint about breakfast, which is served in elegant fashion in a large dining room, is that they might include an egg option as added protein, to counter all the sweets and starches. The hotel is also within reasonable walking distance to just about everything you want to see, particularly the Vatican. It is also close to three stops on the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time ,Take plenty of money”
Reviews.Author: daveandjuls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the visconti palace for 6 nights in September , took the missus there for her 40th birthday....Hotel was excellent overall , the only thing was it took 2 days to get extra pillows??? As you would expect with Rome it was very expensive , the hotel , restaurants etc. We loved it completely but watch out for the taxi drivers at the airport , it is supposed to be 30 euro fixed price from the airport to our hotel....but it wasnt , the mni bar was mega money ; as you would expect. Rome itself is beautiful , if you can get past the huge amount of graffitti and rubbish on the streets you will have an excellent time , loads to see and the visconti palace is ideally situated to see all the major attractions within easy walking distance......its well worth paying the extra few euros for the guided tours , colloseum , vatican etc as you dont have to queue and you get the verbal tour as well....overall its an amazing place , just take plenty of cash and dont buy from the mini bar!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “two days in rome - leave the laptop at home”
Reviews.Author: globalsurferSC
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe double for a 2 night stay. the rate was 190 euro/ night plus 30/night for valet parking. Our overall experience was positive. the room was a bit cramped, but clean and well equipped with modern amenities including the flat screen TV. The breakfast buffet is quite extensive, and the staff were reasonably friendly. The location is not bad for those who enjoy walking. Only one significant drawback; the internet! Possibly one of the slowest ethernet connections (no wireless) I have ever experienced. In fact, its so slow, its not worth the time or expense (15 euro) to connect...nearly all websites timed out before loading. Bottom line; if you really require internet service, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tacotwo
Reviews.Content: We had two nights here before a Carnival curise. Rooms were nice and clean and good size and the staff was frinedly and helpful. No restaurant in the hotel just bar food, and a enjoyable continental breakfast all one needs to start they day. Not a bad walk to St. Peter's. You do need to ask for wash cloths in your bathroom for each day of your stay. Need to use your "key card" to turn on the lights in your room. Louisville,KY

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: proodle
Reviews.Content: I loved the Visconti Palace hotel. Friendly staff, comfortable room and a rooftop terrace. The staff were really helpful - booking taxis and supplying me with maps and tips before I headed out. The room, although looking onto a busy road, was quiet. Only Sky News in English. Internet is payable. Breakfast was adequate...not great, but a good enough buffet to get you and and about in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable choice for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: knitter06
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here on a precruise package. Front desk staff was always pleasant and helpful, the hotel was very clean, and the breakfast was actually pretty extensive- cereals, fruits, meats and cheeses, and pastries. It is in a reasonably convenient location, especially if you are OK with using bus/metro to get to some sites which are further away, such as the synagogue or the Colliseum. There are several neighborhood restaurants to choose from. The only "drawback", if you want to call it that, is that it doesn't have the charm of an older hotel- it is quite contemporary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Nice Breakfasts :-)”
Reviews.Author: mrs_fumanchu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Visconti Palace hotel for 4 nights in March. We had read the reviews about surly staff and disappointing breakfasts, and I am pleased to report that we found the exact opposite. The staff were welcoming, pleasant and efficient, the lobby area is bright and welcoming. We scored with our room as we had a suite (we had just booked an ordinary room) Room was lovely and very clean. Breakfast was great, buffet style, They have a massive selection of cereals, fruits, breads, rolls, meats and cheeses, then (if you have room) lots of pastries and croissants (The warm chocolate croissants were my personal favourite!) Nice bar area, with ouside seating, and a lovely outside seating area on the 7th floor. I loved loved loved Rome and am def going back, and would def stay at Visconti palace again. Its about a 30 minute stroll to the Trevi fountain, 5 mins to Castel St Angelo and 40 mins to the Spanish Steps Top Tip, 1 Dont mistake the nearby bank for the hotel , they are deceivingly similar ! ! 2 Dont bring your pretty heeled shoes to Rome, the cobbles will ruin them, flat comfy shoes are essential !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: EmmaLouB
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from Rome and had a fantastic time. We stayed at the Visconti Palace Hotel for 3 nights and had a very enjoyable stay. We found the staff friendly and very helpful. The rooms were clean and a pretty good size for Europe. The buffet breakfast was also very good with a selection for all tastes. We found the hotel to be in a good location and walked to all the main attractions. We are planning to go back to Rome at some point as we found we could not see everything within the 3 days. I would definitely return to the Visconti Hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ugm1ejo
Reviews.Content: Spent six nights in the Hotel Visconti Palace in Rome in November 07. On arrival we had a friendly welcome from the numerous reception staff. All were keen to help with a variety of questions regarding the hotel itself, the location and about Rome itself. The reception area, bar and lounge are modern and well maintained. The bar stocks a vast array of drinks - I was particularly impressd to find Pimms! The restaurant is located in the basement. Again, it is modern and well maintained. They serve a buffet style breakfast which would cater for most tastes. The food is a good quality and regularly replenished, there are also plenty of tables, so it doesn't matter if you fancy a bit of a lie in. I'm not sure if the restaurant offers meals other than breakfast as we always ate out. The bar does serve a variety of bar snacks though and the room service menu was fairly extensive. The rooms were well appointed and spotless. Maid service was daily. The rooms are a good size for europe - there's plenty of room for all your luggage and to wander around in comfort. We found the beds to be quite hard but I appreciate this personal preference. We were not bothered by any external noise either from the corridor, adjacent rooms or outside. The hotel is situated over the river from the main centre of rome. It takes approx 5-10 minutes to walk to the piazza nevona. All of the sites in Rome are within easy walking distance of the hotel. Spanish steps - 20mins, Trevi fountain - 10-15mins. Some obviously take longer than others! The Colleseum probably takes the longest, about 30-45 minutes depending on how energetic you're feeling. The hotel is on a road, which means that your taxi from the airport can drop you off directly outside. A lot of the hotels in the old centre of rome have no road access and you have to find your way through the streets with your suitcases - fine if you know where you're going but we met a number of people during our trip frantically roaming the streets for their hotel! Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is modern, spacious and well maintained. It doesn't provide the ornate roman feel that some of the older classic hotels have but for us that was one of the reasons we chose it. Its a fantastic base to explore Rome on foot.

Reviews.Title: “modern oasis in beautiful Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tedolita
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in July 07, and chose the hotel because of its location and price. As it says in the website, it is a very modern hotel, with a nice lobby and beautiful, if a bit small, rooms.(We did not have a suite, just a standard double) The best thing about it is the area, as it is close enough to walk to most of the shopping and touristic areas of central Rome (Piazza Spagna, Via Condotti, Trevi and The Vatican) but in a peaceful and classy area, very close to lovely restaurants and bars catering for Italian people, and not some of the awful tourist traps you get near Via Venetto. Rome is amazing, but sometimes the crowds get too much and it felt nice to get out of the more touristy areas. The walk from the Vatican to the hotel late one night, walking by the river was absolutely beautiful....well worth the extra walking.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff is extremely RUDE”
Reviews.Author: Cocosnug
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the hotel for 2 nights with my wife. The front desk staff is extremely RUDE!!!!! - don't acknowledge guests when we check in. Don't offer to assist when we were standing there waiting for so long to check in. Even during checking in processing - staff will roll eyes and you and give you that extremely couldn't be bothered to assist you facial expression. Room is very hot and stuffy - room temperature set to 25.8 degrees. Complained about situation and asked to turn on air-conditioning - was told this is not possible during winter period. No choice but to open our windows to let air circulate the room and become more bearable to stay in. Bed is hard, so are the pillows. Porter did not even bother to assist with our luggages when we checked in. I must stay - of all the hotels I have stayed in - and that is a lot all over the world - the front desk staff in this hotel is the absolute worst EVER!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: nottarockstar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Feb 10-14th, 2008. Everything I had heard about a rude staff was totally unseen during my stay. We arrived early in the morning (after a 7:25am arrival) and the hotel was able to clean a room quickly and allow us to check in around 9am with no charge! They were always willing to give us directions, help us with buses/metro, suggestions for food/wine.. Everything was great. The rooms were about what I expected... nothing great but definetly clean. They gave us great soaps and lotions (some name brand, my girlfriend would have to remind me the name.. fernando or something?) and the breakfast was great. NOTE: Don't go to Italy and expect Eggs and pancakes.. this is not what you will get. Meats, cheeses, breads, and fresh squeezed blood Orange Juice were the daily choices - and I enjoyed it every morning. Close by is Vito's for dinner and wine - it was pretty good if you need something close. But if you want amazing, head out to Trastevere - we had amazing pizza out there. Get comfortable and try to speak to the locals, they will point out a good place to go. We even had some offer to walk us to their favorite places - In fact, in Florence we had one offer to join us for lunch! Just be polite and always greet them in their language first - you'll know right away if they are willing to help.. Otherwise, you'll end up at more touristy spots.

Reviews.Title: “Good allrounder - worth it”
Reviews.Author: jetranger73
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay here due to the location and excellent price offered by Expedia for 3 nights. The hotel is in a quiet street , a block from the river Tiber, very close to attractions such as Vatican, Spanish Steps, Via del Corso (shopping), Piazza Navona etc. The room was small-ish but very clean and functional with all things in the room that you'd need. Breakfast buffet was excellent with everything you could probably want (barring a cooked English). The only downside were the bar staff were AWFUL. Every time I went to the bar, I had to be asked to be served, or you'd be ignorred. Maybe an Italian thing. When asking for something they were abrupt and rude. A small downside to an otherwise great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Alphafighter
Reviews.Content: Rooms were larger than most european hotels, breakfast (included) was pretty good. The rooftop patio is a nice place to hang out. Looks like they recently renovated with new fixture and furniture. Clean rooms, convenient location, friendly staff. Good predictable accomadations.

Reviews.Title: “Visconti Palace - menza menza”
Reviews.Author: mcn_mi
Reviews.Content: my husband and I spent 3 nights at the Visconti Palace hotel during our time in Italy on our honeymoon. by European standards, the double room we had was somewhat spacious and seemed clean. we did notice that the walls seemed thin - we could hear a lot of what was going on in adjacent rooms and the hallway. the bathroom was OK - but the shower made me hyperventilate. nothing more than a moldy stand up with a nasty curtain and a clogged drain. the stand up "tub" was about 5 inches deep - so it overflowed with water every time we showered. that part of the experience, I could have done without. the breakfast and bar selections were pretty good. the liquor and wine were reasonably priced. and the breakfast buffet seemed to have something for everyone -- meats, cheeses, breads and cereals. you were also able to order something else if you didn't like what was offered. as far as location, I might stay somewhere different next time - closer to Via Veneto, Via Condotti, or Campo del Fiori for shopping and dining. we were about a 15-20 min walk to those places. just a travel tip - definitely worth paying a few euro for a cab to Termini, if you're catching a train. the front desk was nice enough to arrange our taxi and tour transportation for us. overall, not bad - but I'd probably stay somewhere else next time, just based on location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Morpethian1
Reviews.Content: I agree with the last reviewers comments about staff attitude - we had NO problems at all! The staff could not have been more helpful, friendly and efficient in both service and advice. Even when meeting staff in corridors etc they always made eye contact and gave a spoken greeting. The room was clean, quiet, well decorated and equipped and matched the modern minimalist style of the hotel. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom also well equipped. Buffet breakfast served in the basement breakfast room was standard, but good quality fare and again the serving staff were friendly and efficient. One reviewer implies that the hotel only caters for American cruise tourists; don't be put off by that!!! We were independent travellers from the UK and whilst there WERE large American tour groups in evidence, the hotel seemed to be successfully catering for the full range of business and leisure guests from many countriese who were staying. We ate out in the evenings and there is a fair choice of typical, reasonably priced Italian restaurants within the immediate, safe and pleasant locality. The hotel location was excellent, on the left bank of the Tiber so close to Vatican City (10- 15 mins walk) but also convenient for the sights on the right bank with the Trevi Fountain and Piazza Nouva also about 10 mins. To get up to the Forum and Coloseum we took a 5 min walk to Lepanto Metro and then used the excellent Metro service (1 Euro yes 1 Euro!! each). Before strolling back through the city with a couple of coffee stops! If travelling independently by air I recommend taking a taxi from either of the airports. If you use one of the official white taxis, there is a fixed charge of E30 from Campino and (I think) E40 from LDV to any of the main hotels in the city centre. As this was our first rip to Rome we took 2x1/2 day guided tours on our first day with Gray Line ( Appian Line). These were excellent, gving great information and allowing us to get our bearings so we could then "go solo" for the rest of our trip. If (when!) we return to Rome we would defintiely stay at the Visconti Palace and have no hesitation in recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you don't need any assistance from the staff.”
Reviews.Author: ASHSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: The lobby is nice. The bar is nice. The room is fine. The bathroom is clean. The staff SUCKS!!! I have to say that their staff is probably the rudest I have ever met. I totally agree with the people that gave negative comments toward this hotel's staff. Out of the 7 front desk staffs that I saw during my 4 night stay only 2 were actually friendly and were kind of willing to provide us with infomation. The others were simply rude and doesn't even look at you when they're talking to people. I noticed that they were only friendly enough and patient enough to Italian speakers. They showed no manner nor patience to English speakers. Only the female staff was kind. The only way to obtain hot water is through the bar. The bartender is extremely rude also. One night I was trying to get hot water for my wife and the bartender just kept saying "No more hot water, No more hot water" (rudely) and was blabbering Italian to his colleague, I don't understand Italian but I knew from his tone that he wasn't saying anything nice. By the way, there is no shower curtain so the water is very likely to flood your bathroom floor. However, there is a peice of glass that blocks the water from spilling out the shower but it only covers halfway so you'll have to either bathe or cautiously shower yourself. Water coming out the shower is not always hot enough, so you'll have to take your chances. I'm assuming that's because they use solar panels to heat up the water and there wasn't enough sun light during the day. The location of the hotel is fine if your destination is the Vatican, Via Condotti or Piazza del Popolo, they're all 10-15 minutes away. There are no metros nearby, you'll have to walk for about 12 minutes to the Lepanto station (red line). I wouldn't recommend anyone with heavy luggage to take the metro because there are no elevators around, you'll have to haul it up the stairs yourself. The taxi from/to the Airport is 50 euros, 10 euros more than to any other hotels in Rome, don't know why but that's the way it is. I've confirmed it with 3 sources and that seems to be the general rate. So if don't need any assistance from the hotel staffs, doesn't have a habit of using hot water, and bathe more frequently than shower then this is a place you could consider.

Reviews.Title: “A really good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chops40
Reviews.Content: Firstly I've got to say I can't understand why there were a couple of recent bad reviews about the staff being rude. We stayed there for 4 nights starting 17/10/07 and everyone we had any dealings with were really helpful and friendly - we had no problems at all. The hotel is contemporary and functional in appearance so theres not a lot of character about it, but thats not something that we were bothered about. It's clean and the rooms are comfy and we didn't experience any street noise so got a good nights sleep each night. Breakfast is cold buffet which is fine, plenty of choice. We didn't use the cafe at the hotel, which does some snacks but the food we saw people having looked ok and the prices seemed comparable to those at an average restaurant in town. Theres a terrace on the ground floor which is good for putting your feet up in for a bit with a drink after walking around all day. Theres a roof terrace that you can take your drinks up to too. Its in a good location for getting to all the sights. You could get a taxi, bus or metro but we just walked everywhere and didn't have any problems even walking back late at night. St Peter's is only 15 mins away at a leisurely stroll, with the Vatican Museum only a bit further. You can get to Piazza Navona or Piazza del Popolo in 10 at the most. Even walking to the Colosseum/Forum only took about half an hour. We really enjoyed it and would definately stay there if we went to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room rude staff”
Reviews.Author: sunfanAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and modern. The breakfast was good and we found the bed to be comfortable and the noise level was not bad. We did not like the staff. We were treated very rudely. This was as bad as we were treated going through 4 cities in Italy. One day I went to get a cup of coffee set up in the lobby and one of the hotel workers ripped the cup out of my hand!! He was afraid that I was not going to have charged it to my room. I was speechless. He did it to someone else after me also. The desk workers gave us bad information about everything. They got us on wrong buses and would not even look up to answer our questions. If you could just stay in the room and not deal with any of the people there you would enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: high_standards07
Reviews.Content: This hotel caters to (American) tourists on cruises with a stop in Rome. The service was incredibly rude and unhelpful, despite repeated requests for information. We had a junior suite- the layout and size was nice. But for the money and the attitude we had to deal with- never again.

Reviews.Title: “Would return in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: promotions
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Visconti Palace -- our top floor room featured a lovely balcony (great place for morning coffee while the sounds of the city came to life) and a HUGE, modern bathroom (a bonus especially in European hotels). Ultra hip, cool designs, furniture and artwork throughout. If you like contemporary , uncluttered styling -- you will enjoy this hotel. The lobby bar a great place to meet up with friends and people watch (live jazz was featured when we visited) and the snacks offered with our drinks were fantastic. You will not see a dish of stale crackers on this bar. Visconti Palace also about location, location, location -- you can walk to many of the top tourist sites in minutes including the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and great shopping. Overall, the staff was efficient and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Aworth while stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dollars1996
Reviews.Content: It goes without saying that any international trip or "Holiday" to a historic city is worth the trip. However it can be a challenge to get the features you expect from a hotel at home while abroad. The Hotel Visconti Palace , did a pretty good job of making use feel at home. As African Americans, we take extra care with everything we do on all trips and especially international ones. However, as others will point out, we are all treated as American Tourists regardless of looks. The Hotel Visconti Palace service was the same as others indicated, but the word GREAT should be added. While many people abroad can speak English the staff at the hotel were willing to do so. They spoke English when we checked in, at the bar for coffee or café, during breakfast, while asking for restaurant recommendations & directions, during the handing of billing issues and, well you get the point. The room was a good size for a European hotel. The view was ok, but the location was walking distance to the Vatican, shops, movies and food. The room window could be opened for Rome air (not too fresh) if you wanted. There is a room safe and they even provided some slippers for your feet. These were good for the cold tile bathroom floors. Overall, a good non-boutique hotel. A few things you should know While we give the hotel high marks. There are a few things you should know. Like many European hotels, wash cloths are not apart of the bathroom. Bring you own or buy a sponge. There is no microwave and the mini bar doesn't really get cold. Really, it's hard to find any really cold drinks in Europe. There was no tub in our room and the shower was a hassle with it's thin clingy curtain and not so hot water. But hey it's Rome! Last, there is no hot food at the free breakfast bar. But the coffee is good. All said, the hotel was better than good. Rome can be expensive, but we found great places to eat very cheaply (less than the McDonalds there!) There is a great deli not far from the hotel with breakfast for 2 at only 4,80€. Like many before us, we give the hotel a thumbs up. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “3 Star hotel not centralized to downtown”
Reviews.Author: EVIEGrandRapids
Reviews.Content: Hello! Stayed two (2) nites on a pre-cruise. Selected this hotel because it was the pickup point for Carnival Freedom cruise. The hotel is nice; clean large rooms. Staff was not that friendly EXCEPT for the breakfast staff. Very friendly. Breakfast OK - nice pastry and fruits. Would not order the "hot" breakfast as it is extra and I had a chance to look at the eggs/ham and they were not very appetizing. The area is OK but you really need to keep track or you can get lost. Not as centralized. We did however walk everywhere but our feet felt it. Rome hotels are very expensive. I choose this because it was close to downtown. If I had to do it again; I would stay by Airport and just take the Metro downtown. Safe and efficient. There are Marriott's - Hilton - and others at or near airport which were a lot less. But, it was OK and the rooms were clean and bigger than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on the 7th Floor”
Reviews.Author: MerlZ
Reviews.Content: What a treat to arrive at the chic Visconti Palace in the heat of summer and enjoy a lovely outdoor garden bar and fabulous air conditioning! The new suites on the 7th floor are modern, spacious, and well appointed for the spoiled American traveler. They are still getting in the new hair dryers but the beds and showers were great! There is an elaborate breakfast buffet and the staff was very accommodating. My children loved the hot chocolate in the morning! Drinks at the indoor bar was also nice as they brought lovely snacks and made you feel welcome. The hotel was fun and not stuffy. I was worried about the location but it was just a five minute walk over the bridge to the Via Condotti and the Spanish Steps. I would definitely go back to the Visconti Palace again. Jody Leibowitz Morristown, New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Great Clean hotel in handy location”
Reviews.Author: GPHerts
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a lovely stay at the Visconti Palace. Ok so the hotel isn't as characterful and romantic as some places, but to compensate you get a good sized room, lovely and clean, great aircon and efficient pleasant staff. We also managed to get a great 3 for the price of 2 nights stay on the internet - so it was excellent value all in a good central location - what more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “My Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: 1968birchwood
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, modern and located well for sightseeing. The Visconti Palace was only around 20 minutes from the main attractions of Rome eg The Vatican, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain therefore ideal for those wanting to explore. The hotel was very modern and all areas were well maintained and kept clean. The bedrooms were also spacious (we stayed in a family room for three) and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: jenjem
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome a few months ago with my boyfriend and we stayed at the Visconti Palace. This hotel is the perfect place to stay in Rome. It's near the center and within walking distance to all the major sights. They have a quaint outdoor patio that is a perfect spot to eat a snack and have a few cocktails. We found it to be a nice place to relax after a full day of sightseeing. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful in organizing tours and offering dinner suggestions. I look forward to coming back to Rome and would for sure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern and Really Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rosalind123
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Visconti Palace, and am grateful once again to TripAdvisor for helping us find a great hotel. The public areas and bedrooms are very clean and nicely furnished in a modern, minimalist style. Our twin room on the 6th floor was quiet, spacious with efficient, if a bit noisy, air conditioning. The bedlinen appeared to be changed every day, and we returned to complimentary slippers and mat laid out beside the beds, which was a nice touch. The bathroom was a decent size with modern fittings and hairdryer - only a shower but more refreshing after a day in Rome's heat! We found the hotel Reception staff to be very friendly and helpful - ordering taxis and making dinner reservations for us - whether this is because I spoke Italian to them, I don't know, but they were always welcoming and courteous. The hotel looks nothing from the outside and is in a rather nondescript road but its an easy 10 minutes walk to the Vatican and the same in the other direction to Piazza Popolo. The outside bar area is great to unwind in on an evening, lit with candles and water feature. Drinks are average price for a 4* city hotel. Be aware that in August, many restaurants and some shops are closed for 3 weeks for holidays - nearly all the restaurants near the hotel were shut, hence why we asked for recommendations. The Enoteca Ferrara in Trastavere is fantastic - over 1000 different wines and great food in underground cellars. I would definitely recommend the Visconti Palace for a well priced, well placed, clean and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, cool, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: McFleurry
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Visconti Palace and were very impressed with the hotel. Firstly, in a city where temperatures reach 34 degrees in August, the air coniditioning in the hotel was absolutely wonderful. Had a great few nights sleep. The hotel itself is in a good position, the longest walk we had was to the Colosseum and that was only 30 minutes. We found that walking was the best way to discover the city and found some lovely restuaurants along the way. The rooms are of a good size, spotlessly clean and athough the bathrooms don't have a bath, we found everything we could possibly need was provided. Breakfast was always fresh and there is a great patio area outside to enjoy a pre-dinner drink. All in all I would definitely stay here again, and a good tip is to use the internet provided via the TV. Its 10 euros for 24 hours but its great to be able to send emails from the comfort of your bed when your feet are pounding from a days walking!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: TandPToronto
Reviews.Content: The first three nights of our Italian vacation was spent in Rome at the Visconti Palace. We enjoyed the Visconti so much that we would not even consider staying anywhere else. The rooms were adequate in size, very clean and we appreciated the air-conditioning as Rome was sweltering in the high 30’s C. The bathroom was nice with a small shower (no bath). The staff were extremely courteous and helpful. The hotel was very quiet especially since it is not on a main thoroughfare, but its best feature is the location. It is on the northern perimeter of the “tourist area” just west of the Tiber River. It was at most a 15 minute walk to Vatican City in one direction and 10 minutes to the Piazza del Popollo just over the Tiber in the other direction. Once there you can walk down the Via del Corso and in 10 - 15 minutes you are at the Spanish Steps, then the Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, etc. You cannot ask for a more central location to everything you need and want to see in Rome. We walked to everything - even the farther off destinations. There is a metro station about a 5 minute walk from the hotel that can take you to most any place if you don’t fancy walking. The breakfast was included in our rates and it was a cold buffet serving pastries, cereal, fruits, deli meats, cheeses, juices, etc. It would have been nice to have hot eggs but overall it was very satisfying. The only negative aspect to our stay was the hairdryer which kept shutting off after a couple of minutes but would take 10 to be cool enough to operate again. After numerous calls to the front desk, they finally lent us one (which we hid in our suitcase so that the housekeeper wouldn’t return it). We booked thru Hotels.ca and got the 3rd night free. Would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: New Orleans gal
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the Visconti Palace before our cruise. The rooms were a very nice size - especially for a European hotel. The hotel was quiet and served an adequate - if somewhat monotonous cold breakfast, but the staff was very efficient and kept the buffet full. The breakfast was included in the price of the hotel. The bathroom was nice with a small shower, but is was clean and well stocked with soap, shampoo, etc. We had a king sized bed that was comfortable, but the pillows were not great. The location made this an ideal place to stay. It was at most a 10 minute walk to Vatican City in one direction and 10-15 minutes to the Spanish Steps and Plaza. There is no restaurant in the hotel for dinner, but an easy walk to many - especially if you cross the Tiber River. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted a nice, basic modern hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet area, clean and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: vegiegirl_7
Reviews.Content: My family of four (two children aged 10 and 14) stayed at the Visconti Palace for 4 nights towards the end of July. The hotel is in a quiet area but 10 minutes of walking gets you to good shops as well as tourist attractions. Close to the hotel are several nice restaurants. We booked two double rooms interconnecting. One had a king size bed and the other had two singles. Both rooms were very clean, comfortable and were a good size. The air conditioning was a God-send since the temperatures were in the mid thirties every day. The breakfast room was very large and the food plentiful. I would have loved to have been able to make some toast but sadly european hotels don't seem to possess toasters. Another thing I thought was strange was that when I requested an iron to borrow, I was told that iron's are not permitted in hotels there (something to do with the wiring I think?) I have never come across this before but I've never stayed in Rome before so maybe that's normal over there???? We found the desk staff to be very pleasant and most spoke good English. In fact they were very helpfull when I left my sunglasses behind in a taxi that we'd ordered from the hotel. They made repeated phone calls to various taxi companies until they tracked down the taxi we'd travelled in earlier that morning and the driver returned the sunglasses later that day. A couple of tips on Rome: If you want to visit the Vatican City and see the Vatican museums (where you'll see the Sistene Chapel amongst other things), it might be best to join a tour group and go early in the morning. The conceirge can organise this for you. If you go separately (which you can't do before 10am), the queues are unbelievable - 2 to 4 hours long and they wind all the way around the Vatican City's walls. Also be aware that you must have your shoulders and knees covered. You won't be allowed in if they are exposed. (Three quarter pants are fine and a scarf draped over the shoulders seems to suffice). Also, beware of the gypsies!! Thankfully we had been pre-warned about gypsies carrying babies and trying to make you look at their babies whilst picking your pockets. It happened to us on our first day in Rome. It all happened very quickly but basically two women with babies strapped to their fronts approached us. A young girl distracted myself and my two children by pulling me towards her and blowing kisses at me repeatedly whilst the two women (who look quite ordinary - no big hooped ear-rings and layered skirts here) closed in on my husband showing him their babies. They backed him up against the wall and held one arm tightly when he suddenly remembered what he'd been told. He immediately felt a hand going into his pockets (they make it look as though their hands are supporting the baby). He managed to shake them off and shouted at them to get away which they did but it was obvious from their faces that they were annoyed that they were unsuccessful on this occasion. Rome was not my favourite destination on our holiday but the Visconti Palace made it a comfortable stay. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: BB73
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was reasonably spacious, and very clean. All public areas were immaculate. The downstairs outside area was lovely to sit in for a pre-dinner drink, and didn't find the prices too bad, considering the hotel is a 4*. New rof top terrace looked lovely, but wasn't yet finished for our visit. Hotel is a 15 minute stroll across the Tiber from Piazza Navona, and the nearest metro station is only a 5 minute walk away. Make sure to visit Trastevere area for dinner, lively area with some wonderful restaurants. Taxi from the hotel around 8 Euro. Would defintely stay here again. We got our third night free as booked through expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: newyorkgothamgal
Reviews.Content: I scoured over tons of hotels and reviews to find the perfect hotel for my family's stay in Rome. If your criterias are the following than you will not be disappointed in staying at this hotel: 1. Clean rooms 2. Modern facilities - air conditioning, tubs or showers, cable tv, internet, minibar, hair dryer, room service 3. Quiet neighborhood 4. Walking distance from major attractions - please note most sights are about 10 - 15 minutes walk. As my family is used to walking we didn't mind taking a long stroll to get to major sights. However, if you aren't used to walking this hotel might not be suitable. 5. Inclusive breakfast - if you eat a light breakfast then you don't mind having pastries, cereal, fruits, deli meats and beverages that comes w/your stay at this hotel. However, if you prefer bigger breakfast of eggs, etc than you will need to go elsewhere for breakfast or pay additional to get those items at this hotel. I can't wait to plan my family's next visit to Rome as we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the place”
Reviews.Author: Kusnetsova
Reviews.Content: This is the worst experience of my life. The bar snacks were hugely overpriced e.g. 30 euros for a bottle of very indifferent wine, 8 euros for a toasted sandwich which turned up totally burned on one side (but which had been cunningly turned over so my daughter didn't see it until she picked it up). Also it was far from being in "central Rome" as advertised, we had to walk miles to see anything at all. I am still in great pain from all the trudging. My advice: don't go there. Rather don't go to Rome at all, its far over-rated, the Tiber is an open sewer decorated with at least ten metres either side with dense algae, if you fell in you would die from inhaling noxious fumes before you thankfully drowned. The Vatican is just another dome, the Parthenon a broken wall and the whole place is dense with pickpockets. My daughter had her handbag rifled while a conniving waiter talked to me over my shoulder so I turned my head while the thief took her phone and watch. Sorry I am straying from the point - I should have stuck to the hotel but the whole experienced is so etched in my memory that I threw a one penny piece in the Trevi Fountain and prayed devoutly never to return to Rome. Jenny Richards

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!!”
Reviews.Author: meximelt6482
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying in a junior suite at the Visconti for 5 days. The staff couldn't be more helpful. The room was very comfortable and the location was beyond perfect! Our room was very inviting and the bed was comfortable. The staff in the reception/concierge were so extremely helpful - they guided us through the city for the right restaurants, worth-it attractions and must-see sites. The bar/ lounge staff didn't skip a beat when it came time to order and accomodate our American-isms (special orders) as well as introducing us to different mixed drinks and native wines. The lobby lounge and outdoor seating were totally hip and shiek, the music was cool and underwhelming and I want my own "water-ball" decoration like they have out on the patio. This hotel is PERFECTLY located! You cannot ask for a more central location to everything you need and want to see in Rome. We found ourselves walking to everything - even the farther off destinations because it never really made sense to take a taxi, saving us a ton of euros without us even expecting it. This place is right in the midst of the actual day-to-day of Roman life so no hoards of tourists (you and I) gawking at sites and if you walk 2 blocks and cross the Ponte Cavour, you are exactly where you want to be. You will also look forward to coming back to the Visconti when you are done with it all for peace and quiet. I didn't love the breakfast but that went for all the Italian hotels, so I won't hold it against them. I highly recommend this place if you are used to, or are expecting a shiek, upscale feel without any of the pretention and higher rates of other places located in worse areas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice... a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: FrostD
Reviews.Content: This is quite nice hotel near to the centre of Rome. However it can become a little expensive if staying for a long period of time. The mini-bar, internet and laundry service is particularly price, especially considering that you can walk and short distance and find a supermarket or laundrette. the rooms are very nice and staff fairly friendly. However I did find them to be a moody when I asked my room to be changed. The hotel serves and fairly nice breakfast in the morning but has no restaurant so you have to find your own place to eat in the evenings. The staff will help you find an restaurant depending on the person you ask, as you can imagine with no restaurant they normally here that type of question a lot and point to the closet restaurant despite the quality of the food. To summarise this hotel is in a good location allowing you to visit the main touristy parts of Rome, however can be a little expensive. Staff are fairly friendly depending on how their day has been.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkynana
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March for 2 nights on a weekend getaway wtih my husband. We liked the modern style of the hotel. Alot of hotels in Rome are quite old and traditional. Very nice reception area. We had to wait awhile at reception before they acknowledged us.. other than that, no other complains. It was in a good location, we walked everywhere...later in our trip we also discovered the underground train which was quite easy to use, and within close distance to the hotel when we need to give our tired feed a break from all the walking. Rooms are nice and modern. Comfy. Our bathroom didn't have a tub, but it was a stand up shower. Not a big deal for us. We don't take baths anyway. Mini Bar was stocked with a variety of drinks, at ok prices. Overall, Nice hotel, Nice decor , good location, will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ekus
Reviews.Content: Great value - we booked with a special winter rate at 50% off - such a good deal. The hotel was modern and clean and we enjoyed our stay. The reception was warm and they put us in room 501 which was lovely - large bed and bath with a view of the courtyard. Breakfast was nice - you need to ask for a cappuccino if you don't want coffee from the machine (thanks tripadvisor for alerting us!). We like walking and exploring the neighborhoods in the cities we visit, so we enjoyed the walks over the bridges each day. It's only far to the collosseum so we took a taxi there and walked back. Great to be near the vatican as lines were extremely long and it's a good idea to get there early.

Reviews.Title: “A second visit already booked”
Reviews.Author: MKGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the best idea I ever had. For my best friends birthday I decided to take her to Rome as she had always want to go. I wanted it to be special as it was her 21st. So i was delighted when her eyes light up on entrance to the Visconti Palace. The exterrior was modern and stylish but still had that friendly warm welcome touch. The door was opened for us on arrival and the reception staff were very efficient in checking us in. They booked a taxi to airport for our return and asked if we needed any maps or help seeing any Rome attractions during our stay. I thought this couldn't get any better until I saw the room. It was perfect, everything you would want... clean, smart and well decorated for all tastes. The location was a hot spot too, not being close to the main road I was worried it may be out the way but it wasn't. It was still in good walking distance to many of the attractions especially the riverside and Vatican. Not being near the main road it was nice and quiet in the evening, ideally for a short walk back from the nearby cafe/ restaurants. All in all definately a good choice and worth a second visit back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: elames
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Visconti Palace while on our CIE Italian Tradition Tour. We liked the location away from the hassle of the historic section of town..what a mess!!! We walked side streets near the hotel to see shops where the locals are doing their own shopping..not the overpriced ones where the tourist traps are located. Our room was very nice. Bathroom good but the shower was a bit small. Everything was clean. We had breakfast each morning at the hotel and though still continental, very filling and lots of selectiions. If you must have your eggs with breakfast, you can buy them for 5 Euro! The hotel has a very modern up scale look to it. We didn't have to deal with much of the staff as our tour director took care of everything. But we all agree this hotel was a good choice. Try the Cupola Restaurant just around the corner and down the block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nXPLOSi
Reviews.Content: The Visconti Palace is a very nice hotel in a good location. The staff were very welcoming and helpful and made us feel at home which is very important as not alot of people speak great English! The rooms were very clean and very modern, which was perfect for my taste. The breakfast in the morning was the usual cereals, fruit, yoghurts and cold meat, I didn’t think i'd like it that much, but I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is very near the Spanish Steps, and it’s easily possible to get to all the major attractions if you don’t mind a walk. I'd suggest getting the Metro B Line to the Coliseum and then walking back, as you pass lots of other big attractions. The Metro is very cheap and always entertaining with the musicians going up and down the carts all the time! Be warned though, eating out is very different from what I expected. Hardly any restaurants open till late so it’s usually a sandwich or fast-food outlet if you want something hot. There are lovely restaurants at Piazza Navarro, although can be expensive. My girlfriend and I had a great meal there on our last night which was very romantic and finished off the long weekend well. Overall, a great weekend that I'd recommend to anyone who enjoys seeing the world and travelling, or simply wants a romantic weekend away!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SHE2005
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked to stay at the Capo d'Africa but they were overbooked so moved us to the Visconti Palace. I have to say that my husband & I weren't very happy & in the taxi we both discussing that we didn't want to stay here, it was away from the "ancient" Rome that we had wanted to be near...I'm sure you can imagine what you would be like in that situation! Anyway when we arrived the male recpetionist didn't acknowledge us at all (have since found out that it seems to be the Italian way!) so I said our names & that we were from the Capo d'Africa. They had upgraded us to a one bedroom suite which was very nice, flat screen TVs, lovely bathroom...Only thing it lacked was a nice view! The rest of the hotel was lovely & clean, modern looking and tidy. Breakfast was good. It's not a main tourist area so you need to walk but then again Rome is all about walking! It was about a 10 min walk to the Spanish steps & shopping area. We ate in a lovely restaurant called Recafe which was near a litte square over the Ponte Cavour. The staff couldn't speak much English (which to our eyes is good as it's obviously not a tourist trap!) and it was packed, when we left there was approx 20 people waiting for tables!!! All in all, after all the hassle we had, it turned out that we had a lovely stay & would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancymac
Reviews.Content: We spent three days in Rome at the Visconti Palace Hotel. It is centrally located and within walking distance of most of the major attractions. Our rooms were very comfortable and the staff was extremely courteous and helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: JetsetterLondon
Reviews.Content: I absolutley loved this hotel, me and my boyfirend decided to go as a little break and to do some sightseeing. We decided to take the bus and metro from the airport and was simple to use, we had a little trouble finding the hotel as we got off at the wrong stop by mistake but we got in a taxi and the driver got us there in no time. As soon as we stepped through the door our bags were taken for us, the receptionist gave us a map of the city and circled all the sights and the closest metro station. The room was lovely, really clean and comfortable and very modern which i liked. The breakfast was a little different from what im used to but was still enjoyable, i didn't really like the smell of raw meats first thing in the morning but the cereal, bread and pastries were enough to keep me going till lunch time. We was only a 20 minute walk from the Vatican and i would highly recomend getting there at least an hour before opening times as the ques are huge but dont let this put you off, this is an amazing sight, the Sistine chaple is breathtaking but not as good as the views of the city from the top of the Cupola, do not give this a miss. Also you have to search a while to find a restaurant as most of the eateries are pizza shops but we found a lovely one at the Piazza Nouvona, Dolce Vita, it was amazing. On our last day we were able to keep our luggage in a seperate room after check out time so we could have another walk around before we left and the hotel staff booked a taxi for us to the airport. Overall i would definatly go back to this hotel and this city.

Reviews.Title: “superior customer service”
Reviews.Author: landairseatravel
Reviews.Content: I just returned with a group at the visconti. One of the members had to go to the hospital. As soon as I contacted the front desk they called the ambulance and the assistant manager stay with me until the client was on the way to the hospital. While we were waiting for information I was assured the hotel would do everything they could regarding someone staying on if required. While this was going on, the front desk kept trying to get our escort so I would have a translator at the hospital. I would continue to put my groups in the Visconti. As a travel agent I know value and the Visconti offers value to american travelers staying at their hotel. this would be my first choice in booking travellers to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Russel68
Reviews.Content: We spent last weekend at the Viscount Hotel and we were very satisfied with our selection . The location is excellent, the room was extremely clean and nice, and the staff very helpful. We would definately go back to the Viscount Hotel again. It may be next June or July when , as the receptionist said, the new suites will be ready on the 7th floor with a great balcony and terrace overlooking the city.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Newton66
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for more! Modern, clean and a short walk to wherever you may want to go!! Breakfast - varied and ample enough for anybody! Lovely patio area for a leisurely drink before venturing out for dinner - very peaceful. We had no problems with staff as we hardly ever needed to speak to anybody! We do our homework before we go anywhere and like to make our own mistakes when we are there! We don't bother anybody with mindless questions - so maybe there is your answer?!! Would recommend this hotel without a second thought!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary1974
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Visconti Palace. . The hotel is pleasantly sited near the Villa Borghese and Via Veneto, Piazza del Poppolo and St. Peter basilica. The staff are friendly and helpful and forgive our apalling Italian. The rooms are large, well decorated and very comfortable. The breakfast is in order of rest of hotel. I will return again at the Visconti

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, convenient and modern”
Reviews.Author: bltzflk
Reviews.Content: This was our final stay after two weeks in Italy and it was absolutely the best. The hotel is modern, the front desk staff were extremely helpful (unlike some reviews I've read), the food was good, the room spacious. What is there not to like? Our first afternoon we walked to Vatican City. On another day we walked to the Spanish Steps and on our final day walked hand-in-hand along the Tiber. Guess Rome really is for lovers, even those in their 70s!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was nice!”
Reviews.Author: Radiance
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to post a quick review of the Visconti Palace... After reading all the other reviews, I was wary of staying at the Visconti. However, at least in my experience, the staff were very friendly and helpful and not rude. The rooms are nice, not opulent but nicer than average and larger than typical European hotels. The hotel is not in the city center proper, but still very close to all major attractions. We took taxis everywhere and were on average about 5-6 Euros. If you get a reasonable price at the hotel and don't mind not being right in the city center, this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience!”
Reviews.Author: Silver20906
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights 12/27-30/06 with 2 older kids. Had 3 bed triple-- 3 twins (very firm!). Location was convenient to Ponte Cavour and Piazza Cavour. Several sights were about a 20 min walk away-- Spanish Steps, Vatican and Plaza Navarro. Hotel was on a quiet street-- walked there from Lepanto Metro via Termini Station (10 blocks--get map) and airport train--all worked fine for total cost of about $15 Euros pp--use cab from Lepanto to save energy. Rome streets are a bit hard to navigate because names change every few blocks on side streets. Nobody in the area knew Fred Cesi street or the hotel by name.... Hotel has a flat rate airport service for 50 Euros--good deal for family so you don't have to lug bags down streets (Common sight). Hotel desk staff friendliness scale was as previously reported--ranged from a bit arrogant to extremely nice-- all came through when pressed with questions. The hotel staff provided plenty of toiletries and travel stuff, good toilets, and rooms were serviced very nicely & promptly. Hotel breakfast daily was more than adequate--from 0630 to past 1100 daily which is very convenient if you want to sleep in. Breakfasts consisted of cold foods--pastries & breads, fresh & canned fruit, yogurt, hot drinks, plenty of cereals, sliced deli meats & cheeses.. better selection than home for us! Lots of tour groups--a bit noisy in the evenings in the hotel. We stayed in room 115--fairly quiet for big city and could take stairs if we wanted to. Rooms were modern, baths had hand shower device and hair dryer with 1 setting--okay though. Great time of year to visit Rome-- cool, sunny and dry weather compared to other parts of Europe. Plenty of reasonable pizza and Trattorias nearby. Try "Luncha" for quick daytime meal. Grocery nearby makes sandwiches for lunch. Comared to London, traveling and eating in Rome is much cheaper. Came home with money. Used ATMs not exchanges for money.

Reviews.Title: “It will suffice”
Reviews.Author: tomdelux
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is beautiful--loved the Foscarini lamps, the patio sphere water fountain and the pebbles illuminated from below--very cool. Wish the beauty extended into the hotel rooms which are o.k. but nothing special except for the flat screen t.v.'s. The bathrooms really need to be fully renovated. The staff was proficient but not overly friendly as they are extremely busy with busloads of tour groups. The only hot item in the basement breakfast buffet is the coffee. I enjoyed the location being close to the Vatican and a short walk across the bridge to the new Ara Pacis museum and the Via Condotti just beyond. The Piazza Navonna is close at hand too. This is just another big hotel which could be anywhere. Wish there had been a view so that I would know that I was in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Visconti”
Reviews.Author: TACH
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days in Rome staying at the Visconti Palace. This hotel is smartly decorated and very clean but the staff were a big let down. On check-in we were aked for our passports and booking confirmation and given our room key, no conversation, no welcome, no information about breakfast - which we'd paid for. We booked a double non-smoking room and were given a twin smoking room, apart from that the accomodation was satisfactory. The hotel has a bar and serves light food which is a bonus in Rome, it also has a pleasant outdoor patio area, however it was not welcoming. The staff were simply rude, they did not offer to serve us when we sat at the bar in front of them - we felt like we had to interupt them and ask if we could have a drink, etc. although they all spoke english, the only conversation was - "cash or charge to room". This wasn't just our experience I heard them being extremely sour and rude to many american guests too. On the one occassion I dared to complain at receiving green tea when I asked for mint tea, the waiter simply replied - "that's all we have", despite telling me they had mint tea when I enquired before ordering it. This location is convenient for the Vatican area, but unless you want to go there a lot, all the other attractions are across the river, so it wasn't as central as we thought. This was poor value for money and I certainly wouldn't recommend staying here when there are so many other hotel and appartment choices, we spent the minimum time in our hotel as we felt so uncomfortable and unwelcomed there, the atmosphere was dire.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: Jasminedog
Reviews.Content: Our family of 11 reserved 5 rooms at the Visconti Palace for our July 2006 visit to Rome and everyone agreed it was a great centrally located hotel. We would definitely stay here again and believe the Positives clearly outweigh any Negatives. Reserve here with confidence. The hotel was full, but rarely felt busy even during the morning breakfast rush. There was no problem checking in and all five of our rooms were ready to be occupied at check in. The hotel rooms were not huge by U.S. standards, but few European hotel rooms are. The AC worked fine, the windows blocked out noise sufficiently well and the televisions were large. The room decor was Danish modern, but not on par to the quality of furnishings in the lobby. The website photo of the rooms were much more beautiful than the reality (as far as our 5 rooms anyway), but nevertheless we had no real complaint about the rooms. The breakfast buffet was fine and typically European - cold sliced meats and cheeses, 4 kinds of cereals, various breakfast breads, pastries, muffins and croissants, fresh whole and fresh sliced fruits, yogurt, and coffee, hot chocolate, tea were fully enjoyed by even our younger picky eaters of the family. The breakfast room was huge and very modern. We used the fitness center regularly. All of the equipment was in excellent condition. There was a treadmill, elliptical stepper, recumbent bicycle, free weights and about 4 weight stations to work the legs and upper arms and chest and back. The fitness room also had a 42 inch plasma flat screen and his/her rest room/changing facilities. We crossed over the Ponte Cavour bridge to easily access the Spanish Steps and to view the Ara Pacis (and purchase our Roma Passes, helping us to bypass the lines at the Coliseum and giving us 3 day of bus and Metro access). The Ponte Umberto bridge (in front of the nearby Palace of Justice) led us directly to the night scene at the Piazza Navonna. The Positives: (1) The hotel is easily accessible to the great parts of central Rome that are especially great places to be during the evening ... Spanish Steps (immediately east) and Piazza Navona (directly south). (2) The location is in a fairly quiet area off Piazza Cavour and therefore does not have to contend with the intense traffic and noise of Rome. (3) Public buses were 1 block and the subway was easily accessed at the Spanish Steps (15 min walk). (4) The rooms are clean, nicely maintained and air conditioned. A good breakfast buffet was included each morning. Furnishings were fine and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was spotless and the custom towels were very fluffy. We had no noise problems in any of our rooms. (5) Public facilities in the lobby are very modern in style. The fitness room was nicely equipped (for being in Rome). There is a small bar with a cozy outdoor patio off the lobby. (6) Modern electrical outlets meant we only needed the 2-prong adaptor, and we did not need our electrical converter. The hair dryer in the bathroom was also powerful. The Negatives: (1) The hotel's quiet location meant that there was not much for the first time tourist to do in the immediate neighborhood. A handful of restaurants were in the area, but it was still pretty lonesome at night. So we always walked over to Piazza Navona. (2) The desk staff, as previous posters have written, could be friendlier, but this was not really a problem for us at all. In fact, the senior gentleman at the front desk went out of his way to help me with directions to various sights. (3) The hotel lacks any pool to cool off after a hot day in Rome (there are only a handful of Rome hotels that have a pool). (4) The hotel is not near the Coliseum and Forum and Via Veneto (but all easily accessed by Subway). The Vatican would have been a 30-minute walk away, but only a few minutes by bus at Piazza Cavour. (5) The rooms can only be booked as doubles or triples. No Quads. Therefore we had to book multiple rooms to accommodate everyone. The hotel is great for couples or 3 person families and those who want the modern conveniences of a hotel in a very central location to most of the sights of Rome. The hotel is not for those who want the old "atmosphere" of small intimate pensiones. Having done the latter, we would gladly opt return to the Visconti Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mcphail858
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a week in Italy. While in Rome, we stayed at the Visconti Palace Hotel. I thought the rooms were outstanding! You will have a difficult time finding a room this new and clean. Not sure when the hotel opened but the room looked brand new to me. The front desk was always able to answer questions but not the most personable. Breakfast was nothing special but was typical of what we experienced in Florence and Venice. Location was outstanding in the fact that is was only a 10-15 minute walk into the heart of Rome. You can take a cab but it was nice to cross over the river each time because of the wonderful view of the Vatican. Plus, right before you cross the river on the hotel side, there is a wonderful cafe with sandwiches and gelato. Remember, if you sit down, it will cost you more than if you stand at the counter and eat. Overall, I would definately stay here next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gryffindor-House
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, excellent location. Very, very highly recomended. Only downside, as expected, was front desk - not rude, but arrogant. Based on previous reviews, I expected this, so not disappointed. However, front desk upgraded my room on arrival from Standard Triple room to a Junior Suite, resulting in 2 spacious bedrooms and large bathroom. Rooms much, much more spacious than what I had booked, and at no extra cost to me. Thanks Visconti! Rest of staff very pleasant and helpful. Hotel extremely clean and modern. Bed linen changed every day (we stopped 8 nights). Air conditioining exceptionally good. Buffet breakfast superb, wide variety of continental breakfast food, including pastries, cheeses, meats, yoghurts, fruits in syrup, and much much more. Hotel within 15-20 minute walking distance of Vatican, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain & Piazza Navona. Colosseum & Roman Forum further away, on other side of city - 45 minute walk or 10 mins by Metro (2 blocks away). Taxi rank nearby in Piazza Cavour, a 5 minute walk from hotel. Very pleasant outdoor terrace, very relaxing after a day out in the city. Hot tip - use fridge in room for keeping your own cold bottled water / drinks. I most certainly intend to stay at this hotel again. Great location, within walking distance of most major tourist attractions. It was very comfortable and relaxing. It had everthing I needed and I didn't have a single complaint during an 8 night stay. Getting the most out of your stay: Plan trip with good guide book. Walking is best way to get around, definitely have comfortable footwear. Vatican is worth at least a day, if not more. Must do's - St Peter's Basilica and Dome, Papal Treasury and Vatican Museums including awesome Sistine Chapel. Do visit Piazza del Popello and church there called Santa Maria del Popello - just 5 to 10 minutes from the hotel (in the opposite direction from Vatican). Hang out people watching in Piazza Navona & closeby at the Pantheon & Campo D'Fiori. Treat yourself to a gelato every single afternoon and/or evening ! Try Fornello La Renala in Trastevere - the pizza here is worth crossing rivers for !

Reviews.Title: “Visconti is really just okay”
Reviews.Author: love2laugh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Visconti for 2 nights in Rome. It really is just an okay hotel. Not bad, but nothing spectacular either. The best thing about the hotel is probably its location, as it is a fairly short walk to the Piazza Navona and to the Vatican. About a 15 minute walk. The hotel itself might seem modern in the lobby and common areas, but the rooms are of average size, rather plain and the bathroom a bit run-down for a hotel of this caliber. The hotel cleaning staff was a bit cheap on replenishing shampoo and soap and toiletries and such. The staff seemed fine, we didn't encounter any rudeness or any unwilingness to help us out. One other thing to note, typically, I'm not super picky about what hotels serve for breakfasts, nor does it determine if I'll stay at a hotel or not, but I would say that the Visconti breakfast was rather cheap in what they served. There were no hot foods at breakfast, not even powdered eggs or sausages. It was just cereal, yogurt, bread, pastries, deli meats and cheese. And the regular, coffee and orange juice. I would say it was probably one of the worst hotel breakfasts I've ever had in that sense. Bad for a hotel of this caliber. We didn't even bother going again for the second day. Just something I was not prepared for. We had problems sleeping for the 2 nights in our hotel because the street noise was also a bit loud for us, if I remember correctly we stayed towards the backside of the hotel. I would rate this a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March with some rugby friends and I can say that this is the best hotel we have stayed in. Staff were polite and helpful. Rooms were big and clean. Breakfast was enough to start the day and the room where you ate was a lot brighter than most hotels we have been in. The location cannot be faulted as you can walk to most of the sights. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we went to this hotel as part of a rugby tour and were delighted with the choice. The location, right near the vatican was excellent. The rooms were delightful, clean, very well furnished and cosy. The breakfast was amazing the buffet was all and more that you could ask for. Should you stay in this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed once but not again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I sent 5 days in Rome mid July, and we are going back this April; on looking for a Hotel to stay at we knew we did not want to stat at the Visconte Hotel again, we travel often and aways remember that we are guest in that country. But this hotel staff is not very freindly at all, they just seemed to have an attitude about everything, you would walk up to the counter to have them call a taxi, they would see you, and keep doing what they were doing or talking to each other and at some point, when they were ready, they would come over to ask what you needed. I did see a lot of tour groups comming and going mostly for cruise ships and that may have made them irritable. The hotel is nice and clean the breakfast buffet is very good and the rooms although small were nicely done. So if you want a nice hotel but with poor service this should do.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: macls
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location plus very clean and well decorated. the staff were helpful and pleasent. the breakfast room would benifit from a toaster. We loved Italy but beware of the unlicenced taxi,s as you get off the bus from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, and that is all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in Mid Jan 2006. I can not complain about the Visconti Hotel, and that is about all I can say about it. It was exceptionally clean, comfortable beds, large (for European standards) rooms, polite staff. Like other reviewers though, I do feel this hotel is geared toward the business traveler. I would not say the staff is rude, but it almost seems they do not try and help unless pressed for it. Internet access in the hotel is an outrageous 10 euros per hour, the hotel bar has 10 Euro cocktails, and other amenities that usually cost a little extra in most hotels are a major expense here. Walk 20 ft away from the hotel and all that other stuff is 1/4 the price. On the upside, it is VERY close to St. Peters, Vatican, Spanish Steps and may other attractions. Restaurants in the area are passable, but to hit the best places see the Lonely Planet Travel book of Rome or Italy, It was bang on every time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but I agree about the staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a 4 nights stay at the Visconti. The hotel is definitely in a good location to walk to all the major sights. The rooms are a good size and clean. Breakfast is good too. Although the staff are a lot to be desired.....all male staff members are very standoffish and on our first evening there we asked one of the porters directions to a restaurant....and he claims he didn't speak english......this being the same porter who showed us to our room when we first arrived and spoke perfect english then. The barman wasn't very friendly either the one night we went down there. To be honest though, we didn't have much interaction with the staff during our stay so it didn't annoy us too much. We had all our maps and guidebooks before we went so we didn't have to ask them for much at all.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the Visconti”
Reviews.Author: croakey
Reviews.Content: Great location (all Rome's highlights are in walking distance), helpful and efficient (although perhaps not charismatic) staff, exceptionally clean and useable rooms with pretty good breakfast thrown in - thoroughly recommended.
